Ratings.comment: Professor is very good. She focuses on eample problems which makes the concepts easier to understand. You will def have a very good understanding of thermodynamics after the class is over. Downsides are that the class requires a lot fo work. There are 7 quizzes/tests that are pretty difficult. Need to put in the work.

7 quizzes each worth 10%, final project to replace the final. Pretty polarized reviews based on whether you like that or not, but she's a really good teacher and makes thermo enjoyable. imo a hard class with a good prof
Makes thermodynamics manageable.

Quizzes graded like exams and not like the lectures or in-class examples. Class failed the first two quizzes, she claimed they would get easier but wasn't true until two quizzes before the final project. The averages on the quizzes were a 60%. She's knowledgeable and cares about her research but shouldn't teach.

Her thermodynamics class made me want to pull my hair out and jump off Mirror Lake. The quizzes were incredibly and unreasonably fast-paced and difficult. The final project was also demanding and lacked clear directions. But hey, I did learn thermodynamics pretty well.

Lectures were well delivered and helpful for homework and exams. Professor is very knowledgeable on the material and has high energy during lecture. Exams were difficult, but fair. End of semester project rather than final was very manageable with a group.
She is knowledgeable and nice, but is not the best at teaching material or making exams. I wouldn't take her class again, but it wasn't horrible.

Professor Belloni isn't a bad professor. She posted the notes which I appreciated, and made the class fairly unstressful, but there were some things I didn't love. Her lectures were just okay and I got by with just the notes. The software we use is EES and imo it's not worth learning, and occasionally I felt like more communication was needed.
Great survey of turbomachinery.

This is the second class I've had her for and she is one of my favorite professors. She cares about her students and does what she can to help us out. There are usually about three midterms, no final, a final project, and concept quizzes.

She's nice, and the work load is pretty fair. There's just a severe lack of continuity in the class. Each lecture feels brand new, and you almost disregard a lot of topics until you have to relearn the for HW/exams. She's okay at explaining things, not the best but not like horrible. Her example problems aren't that helpful either.

She is actually a good teacher, but everything about the way she designs her classes is to make you lose points, regardless of whether or not you know the content. Exams often grade you on stuff you are not explicitly asked to state. Other than that, the exams are graded extremely harshly and will not reflect your understanding and are very fast.

For a 3 credit hour course, she gave us four exams that are worth 55% of the grade, and then a big project in which you need to write tons of pages, and homework each week.  She also puts some "labs" that make you do prework just to make your life harder.  She is there to make sure everyone is suffering and having pressure.  Middle finger to her

Never had a class that offers 4 quizzes that are worth 55% of a grade, it's worse than 5-credit classes. Do not understand why she is making this class so hard, we had two quizzes in 3 weeks with a lot of materials covered, her practice exams are helpless, some of the questions on the exam are new, and she asks a lot of detailed concept questions.

We have 4 "quizzes" worth 55% of our grade for a 3-credit class(yes she won't call those exams).  A lot of materials are covered, and we took 2 quizzes in 3 weeks, too much pressure along with other assignments from other courses.  Her notes are tough to follow with bad handwriting, so you have to attend the lectures or you wouldn't understand. Run
Run!
Hard exam terrible course

I think she is a great professor! It is not very difficult to understand her class and the homework is easy. We have 5 exams and I do not think they are very difficult, but she is very strict in grading them.

I've been incredibly lucky to have Professor Belloni for both thermodynamics and fluids. Both classes are traditionally feared by mechanical engineering students but I had no trouble with either and ended up learning a lot in both classes thanks to Professor Belloni's great teaching. Very structured class and concise material

Professor Belloni was awesome. Super clear lectures and is dedicated to making sure you pass. The structures of her classes are a bit more work than others because of pre-lecture videos, quizzes, pop quizzes, and homework, but in the end, it's only to help you succeed. Her exams were fairy fair.

Clarissa Belloni was a fantastic teacher and gave the material very understandably and paced. Pre-lecture videos were very helpful and was very fair in grading midterms and final project! Only thing is that it was fairly homework heavy (but she does let you drop one), nonetheless one of the greatest teachers Ive ever had PERIOD! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Overall great professor. The only problem is that she goes kind of slowly in class, which was fine since class attendance wasn't mandatory so I didn't go often. Very helpful with office hours and quick response to email. She is clearly interested in teaching. Lots of practice problems to help prepare for exams. recitations were not very useful.

Great teacher. Her flipped classroom approach was awesome and she made the material very clear. I though thermo was going to be my hardest class this semester and she made it understandable and I'm walking out with a solid grade. I'm very happy she's teaching fluids.

Would take any class with her. I thought thermo would destroy me, but actually ended this class understanding everything, and so pumped to take fluids with her. She is adorable and caring and funny, and clear with expectations. Also very nice.

Mokashi is a brilliant lecturer who makes complex topics easy to grasp. His clear explanations and focus on practice problems are super helpful. Definitely take advantage of Unstuck study and other study aids to ace this class.

Great guy, teaches well and makes it known that you can always ask questions. Occasionally asks class for steps needed to solve a problem. Graded on very few things, we only had a few sets of homework plus some in class (collaborative) quizzes and the exams. He'll move around dates sometimes in class, so always either go or get notes sent to you
Fantastic professor who cares a lot about students and makes you comfortable with asking questions.

You can tell Prof. Mokashi cares about his students and wants them to do well. He is a really good lecturer and explains things slowly and clearly. The only thing is that he doesn't post any notes online so try not to miss any lectures. Exams are 80% and there is barely any homework or quizzes given throughout the year.

He can't teach properly, never posts his notes online, has his textbook that skips so many explanations, and has problems with no solutions. He throws curveballs in the test, even in his posted notes that he prepared before, He skips on steps and never completes the lecture problems after skipping steps. He is a nice dude but cannot teach well.

One of the greatest professors to grace this earth. Lectures are clear and concise, examples are well led and discussed, homework is good, and exams were similar. The most important thing to take away is to take your time and to relax. The topics taught are simple (for the most part); silly mistakes will cost you dearly (30 pts/midterm).
Great Professor, tough class but Mokashi is by far one of the best professors I have had
One of the best professors in the ME department. Just go to lectures, do the homeworks and you will get a really solid understanding of the class.

He genuinely cares about his students and goes out of his way to make himself accessible and approachable. Lectures are helpful, clear, and consists of a lot of practice problems. The exams can be hard but they are fair and he outlines exactly what will be covered. Don't skip class, take notes, and review what he tells you to and you will do well.

Mokashi is a brilliant and entertaining lecturer who is always willing to help out a struggling student. My only critique is that he gets very behind with grading and posting homework assignments, but is nevertheless a great teacher. He doesn't post lectures online, and the textbook is not nearly as clear as his lectures, so do not miss class.

Going to Mokashi's class was entertaining and resourceful. The combination of practice problems and actually learning stuff within class made the class a lot easier as well. He will tell you what to do to receive an A before exams, all you have to do is simply do the practice problems he assigns online and you'll pass.

Interesting professor with fun mannerisms and jokes. He cares a lot about the course material and the success of his students. The exams were relatively easy, did not post notes online though so lecture was definitely mandatory. Lab was easy as well, and that's were you truly learn the FEA.

Does not fix mistakes with grading, midterms very hard compared to practice problems. Often forgot to post practice for exams. Quizzes took whole class time with open notes because he usually made many mistakes in the question. Lectures mandatory and does not post notes. Extremely slow pace.

Mokashi is an AMAZING lecturer, he makes very hard content very easy to understand and goes slow in class to make sure all his students understand. He is very friendly outside of class and is flexible when it comes to exams/hws. he did a great job at teaching real applications of the content and rarely lectured the entire class time.

Professor Mokashi should stick to the easier classes. I took him for 3670 and his lectures were the most confusing and boring lectures I have sat through. Material does not make sense. Very space carmen page and little extra help provided to students. Strick grading schedule that doesn't make sense.

Professor Mokashi's lectures are basically just a reiteration of the textbook for the course, but the way he explains things in class makes the content 10x more comprehensible. I really enjoyed having him as my professor for this course, even though the content is rather hard in my opinion.

Online class where lectures are NECESSARY. You didn't have to attend live, but if you didn't watch then you would fail all exams and quizzes. Horrible lecturer, does not explain things well, and id not helpful when you are confused or asking questions. Maybe he is better in person, but I don't know?
Barely anything in the grade book, so if you mess up there is little to no opportunity to make it up. Also, takes ages for things to get graded.

Does not respond to emails. I have an exam from the first month of classes that is still not graded yet (the semester ends this week). Underappreciation of points, my gradebook consists of 4 assignments. Quizzes were only during the month of September as we did not have another way to earn points other than large exams after that. No partial credit

Very lazy... did not put effort into his class. Did not follow his own syllabus and ran out of time to give out assignments. Graded exams very hard and didn't give feedback on first exam until the day before the final. Didn't respond to emails. Would get frustrated by students asking questions. Hardly taught. Worst class experience at OSU so far.

Prof. Mokashi was very good at lecturing and making sure that all students felt comfortable asking questions and understood before moving on. Unfortunately he is not the best administrator, so exam times were often chosen mere days before their date, tests and quiz grades came back very slowly, and he was slow to reply to emails. Would take again

Mokashi is a brilliant man, he is very smart. He is incredibly clear with his lectures, repeating the content at least twice for each important concept. He has a good grasp of the class, and you naturally focus on him. He is sometimes slightly late to class, but is overall helpful and a great professor.

Mokashi explains each and every problem he does in class incredibly clearly. He will tell you exactly what is on each exam. If you know how to do the problems in class and the practice problems he puts up the class will be breeze.

Mokashi is a fantastic lecturer with extremely clear examples and the best drawing skills I've ever seen. He explains things in a slow and logical way making complex problems easy to understand. Exams and homeworks are fair and he usually tells you exactly what problems will be on the exams.

he is a great professor, but hard grader and you need to do everything perfectly on the exams to get a good grade. Also, he is not lean on partial credit, just be careful when you do your exam, double check everything before you turn in the exam.

He is excellent at explaining material and gives clear examples. I thought the class was still difficult though. I went into the exam thinking I was ready and even felt good after the exam, but ended up not doing as well as I thought. He doesn't seem to be very lenient with partial credit.

He's one of best professors I've had so far. Gives clear examples and explanations. Tests were moderate to difficult. If you can do the problems on the syllabus and the extra practice problems he assigns, you should be fine. Only complaint is that he's a poor administrator. Very slow in grading and handing back quizzes and assignments.

The best instructor I've had in engineering so far. His examples are so clear and he explains things in a really orderly way. His writing/drawing is a thing of beauty. Administratively lacking, but doing the practice problems listed on the syllabus is enough to keep up and he is great about helping with problems you have issues with.
Very good looking man, and great teacher

Great lecturer, there's no question about it. Very clear about the expectations and passionate about the subject. Tests were moderate/ difficult. However, he was a poor administrator. Took weeks to get HW/ Quizzes back, and Carmen was underutilized, so often times I was in the dark on my standing in the class. Good overall, but can be frustrating.

Solid lecturer, unfortunately I did not get to see him at his full power as the lecture hall had a white board instead if a black board. The exams and HW were very reasonable and he was very good at preparing us for them.

Had Mokashi for 2010 and 2020 so I can't speak for other professors, but from what I've heard, he's the best of all the entry level ME classes. Great guy and go see him at office hours for some help if you're struggling and you'll pass no problem. His tests are hard but fair.
If you have the choice to take him, you take him.  Mokashi is the man.
Take mokashi for mechE 2010, 2020, and 2030. You will not regret it he is a great teacher

Hands down best professor I've had at Ohio State. It is difficult to get an A, but that is because the course is hard. Mokashi provides excellent practice problems in class, and he is very helpful when answering questions. Go to class, do practice problems, and prepare for exams result in easy B at worst

He is a great lecturer, working examples in class that are directly related to the exams. He was also very respectful to us students, sometimes asking us what the best time would be during the week to give a quiz. If you do plenty of practice problems you will do well in the class, but you must have a very good understanding to get an A (o.w. B/C).
Mokashi was very clear in his lectures and his drawings/diagrams were great. Do a bunch of problems (book and ones he gives you) and you'll be fine.
He is the man, great lecturer and I honestly wish I could have him in another class.

Best lecturer ever. Worst class administrator. Very sassy. Really enjoyed going to his class. Test. Arent hard, but are very rushed. If you put in the work you will probably get a b, no better no worse

Directly from the mouth of Dr. Mokashi himself: "This class is easy to get a B in but will be hard to get an A".  Statics is not a fundamentally difficult course but it is algebraically intense at times. Only extremely careful work under testing conditions will get you an flat A.
Makes an impassable class a little more passable. Very helpful and clear in his lectures and office hours. Highly recommended.

One of the best professors at OSU. His lectures are clear, solves examples  on the board and explains everything very clearly.  Office hours are very helpful. Highly recommended. He makes an already tough subject .easier
The best professor I have ever had! Helps me to the day with other classes. " if you know how to draw free body diagrams you will pass the class".
Mokashi is the man. Wants all of his students to pass and do well.
Mokashi is the best, his handwriting and drawings are amazing

This class will be much easier if you do book problems along the way (Learn from my mistakes!). There weren't any hw assignments after the second midterm, so that really was the only practice you got.

Incredibly caring professor. Makes what most students hate (physics) clear and understandable. His exams, however, are incredibly challenging to complete in only 55 minutes.  Fairly tough questions as well. I actually really enjoyed attending the class, he is really funny and answers questions with detail and examples.
Best Engineering teacher by far. Take any class he teaches

Great lecturer, made a subject I normally hate (physics) clear and easy to learn. Tests were very straight forward and grading was always fair. Really wants his students to learn and do well. Would definitely recommend taking him if you get the chance!
Dr. Mokashi is the man.  He was really clear when he taught and didn't throw any curveballs with his tests.  If you can get into his class, do it.
One word: Perfect Prof, you can tell he loves teaching and he care about his students. Take him if you get chance.

The best ME professor I've had so far.  Explains things incredibly well and genuinely cares about his students- he wants you to do well.  Dynamics is a very difficult course, but Dr.Mokashi makes it easier to grasp.

Grades on a curve. Explains everything slowly and changes pace to keep with class ability. Slow to grade papers and update online. He puts the problems online, so you dont need the book. Very patient and helpful
Mokashi is the man. Take him if you get the chance. The subject is not easy but if you study, you'll get good grade.
Great teacher, helpful, nice and want you do well.

Best professor I have come across yet at OSU.  Does an excellent job breaking down very difficult information and problems.  Genuinely cares and wants to see students succeed.  And has the best chalk board skills ever.

Let's face it, this guy is an absolute genius. The class was incredibly difficult but he is such a good teacher. He writes clearly on the chalkboard and thoroughly explains everything. I would highly recommend Mokashi because he knows a lot about what he's teaching and can be very helpful if you aren't too intimidated by him!

Worked my ass off for an A. The only way I did it is that he was nice enough to tell us 15 problems that were possibly on the final and I memorized every one step by step. SUNY has lectures online for their dynamics class and I preferred their professor by a little bit, but Mokashi is still great.

Totally an awesome prof.  You'll never have a question that he can't answer, he's fair, and he draws the best circles on the planet!  3D sketch on the chalkboard?  He beasts them.  If you have an option, take Mokashi.  If you can't, wait till you can.  Because he's that good.

Best engineering prof at OSU.  He will make you think and he will make you study.  But he is extremely helful, crystal clear, and very kind.  Additionally, he's funny, has the best handwriting of any prof that I've ever had, and draws the best circles in the world!  TAKE HIM!
Excellent Prof.
Best professor ever....he writes everything on board...He work hard to make his students better.............
AMAZING!!! I hate physics/statics and mechanics but he has made the class enjoyable. He is very clear and concise plus his handwriting is literally perfect!!
I'm going to try to schedule him in the future whenever possible.

Mokashi is by far the best professor I've had at osu, even though he has tough midterms/final.  I've never learned as much in lectures but he is great at describing situations. Highly recommended as a professor but requires a good amount of studying.

He's ok. He teaches the material well, but doesn't go over many practice problems. His homeworks are extremely hard, his quizzes are book problems, and his exams can range from fairly easy to fairly impossible. I reccomend him, but if there's someone better, take them instead!

Wow.  He's a sensational lecturer.  His online homeworks are hard but TAs provide a lot of help and equations in office hours.  Tests are straightforward IF you've done all or most of the practice problems and prepared  well.  If you let him, he will teach wonders to you.
Great teacher.  I would highly recommend him as a teacher.  Funny teacher and quizes/tests are reasonable.  Recitations are mandatory, but very easy.
Nice
The greatest professor I have had at OSU. Thank the gods if you get Mokashi as your professor, you will LEARN. He even has good jokes.
I had him for 210, 420, and 430. Best professor in the ME department! Do anything you can to have him as your professor!!!

I had him for ME410-430 and now have him for ME 639. Mokashi is the best professor in the ME department that I have come across. I highly recommend taking a class that he teaches. He moves through material quickly, yet covers everything and more. I hope I have him for some graduate classes. YAAAAAAHHHHH!
Sweeet
He is the best teacher I've ever met.
Very good! Explain problems clearly
Dynamics is insanely hard regardless of the teacher, but he does a great job of explaining abstract ideas.

Dr. Mokashi... He's the man! I love the guy... Best Teacher in the departement, and probably the best in engineering, had him for 410 and I have him for 430 next quarter. He is an Excellent teacher, His tests are hard,but nothing that wasnt explained in class. study for them, and dont slack in this class. I WOULDNT RECOMMEND SKIPPING ANY LECTURES

Dr. Mokashi is an amazing professor. I took ME 410 from him and learned the material so well that I'm also taking 430 and 420 from him. His Indian accent is easy to get passed everyone I talk to thinks that he is an amazing professor as do I.

Great Teacher! He explains everything very clearly. DO NOT miss any of his lecture, I missed just one lecture and  had no clue what was going on in the next lecture.  Tests are pretty hard, but he gives you what to study for before them. I dont think he curves his class or barely curves it had a C  without a curve and thats what I got for the class

Best professor that I've had. Go to lectures because he will randomly take attendance for a grade and the quizzes aren't always announced beforehand. He explains everything very well and does a lot of examples. Take him if you can!!

Awesome prof. Incredible helpful, very very clear, easy to understand and follow. great guy, good personality. strongly recommend him. I will try and get in any other ME class he teaches. seriously one of the best profs at OSU
Best teacher in the engineering program
Stern but fair.  ATTEND CLASS...you will only need the book for HW problems. Tried to get him for ME420 but wouldn't fit my schedule.

By far the best professor I've had at this great university.  Tests were tough but he gives you more than enough material to prepare for it.  I signed up for another class with him at 8:30 in the morning, even though I couldve had him at 12:30 as my first class.  Thats how good he is. Thats what she said, Yaaaaaaaaaah

He's definitely not the easiest teacher, but you will learn a lot. He explains things very clearly in class and is always more than willing to help.  His exams are difficult and he knows it,so expect to work. You have to have some idea, or you'll fail.  Overall I recommend him. He's got the best personality out of any prof i've had. Yaaahhhhh.
YAAAHH!!! thanks for doing some of the homework problems this week, prasad

Yaaaahh, best teacher ever.  His work is very neat and orginized, he turns hard problems into easy ones, very helpful during office hours.  If you can get him for any engineering class, take him, hes the best.
One word Yeaaaahhh. He is awesome get him as a teacher for any engineering.

Very easy class, almost all the tests' problems come from homework or the review session he holds a day or two prior to the test. Maybe it was easy because he's a great teacher, and can communicate very well the methods and ideas used to solve problems. The best part was when someone made him laugh, as he tries to be really professional.

He takes the roughest problems and makes them look so incredibly simple it's deceiving.  If you don't know the material, you won't pass his tests as he is a picky grader and can spot BS from a mile away.
great teacher for this class - just as good or better than most professors (as he's still grad standing) also the book is good - makes a good reference book later on
EXCELLENT PROFESSSOR!!
He's a good professor. He knows the material well, and explains it clearly.

probably the best prof I've ever had.  Very helpful, available, and accomodating.  Very good at conveying concepts.  Use his office hours (and especially Vladimir J. office hours).  Test aren't bad if you understand concepts.  Final was difficult and based largly on new material.  Get Jovovic for TA. P.S. There was a curve. HW was key my to success
Great teacher.  Tests were challenging.  Just make sure you get all the HW points and do well on the quizes and you should be fine.
Very good teacher indeed, but give hard tests.
He knows how to teach. He makes the material clear, yet his test are very difficult, and he is very picky grading.
Excellent professor, makes the material very understandable and makes the class enjoyable

His tests are hard...  if you don't fully understand the material.  He can take something so difficult and make it seem so easy that it's deceiving.  One of the few teachers where when I walked out of their class I was positive I knew the material.  Excellent teacher.

prasad teaches the basics very well...that said, he tests you on the advanced...even though his exams were hard, you will leave his class with a solid grasp of the basics, which is what u'll need down the road anyway...highly recommended
He made this class much simpler than it is.  His breakdown of problems was masterful.  I highly recommend taking Prasad.

Prasad makes the class way easier than it is supposed to be.  Even though this is the first quarter he has ever taught ME 420, he did a hell of a job.  It's unfortunate that he won't be teaching any of my future classes.  Tests are not extremely difficult
Excellent professor for this class.  Made things clear and kept the class interesting.  Tests and quizzes followed things covered in class.
One of the best professors I've ever had. He's always available, and teaches the class by explaining every step. Tests are straight forward. But don't slack off. Its real easy to fall behind.

This guy rocks! I'm in his class now, and I'll say, it's like "Statics for Dummies". He doesn't assume that you know something, instead, he makes sure that you know it, and does not hesitate to backtrack on a subject matter to help you.
very good prof. likes to crack jokes here and there. not a boring class to sit through most of the time. exams were very straightfoward. highly recommended!
Tough course but he tries to explain things in simple terms. Do all the homework and use the availble help sessions!
Very helpful.  Tests followed lectures.  Classes were enjoyable.

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Design and Analysis of Machine Elements I

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Statics and Introduction to Mechanics of Materials

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Statics and Introduction to Mechanics of Materials

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Statics and Introduction to Mechanics of Materials

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Statics and Introduction to Mechanics of Materials

Ratings.comment: AVOID this professor! He is unwilling to help students and doesn't care whether they understand the material or not.
The most inconsiderate teacher who couldn't care less about his students. Would rarely respond to my emails; if he did, he responded with

I thought some of my professors were bad-- Then I had Haijun Su. His lectures were awful, the recitations were unhelpful, and the grading policy was atrocious. There were 5 homeworks, that took me 5+ hours each, and each was 10% of my grade in the class. The other 50% of the grade came from the final exam (Which had only 5 questions). Good luck.

Genuinely the worst professor I've ever had at OSU. Lectures were a waste of time, he barely explains anything and just incoherently rambles the whole time. The homeworks take a long time to complete and there isn't much opportunity to improve your grade. Unfortunately, he is the only person that teaches this course, so you can't even avoid him.

My experience may be different with Dr. Su bc I took one of his high level grad courses, but he was a very good prof for me. Content was very difficult, but he was accessible for help and provided a lot of resources. When 4/4 students in the class failed the midterm project, he worked with us to make sure we knew the material + allowed resubmission
Very bad professor. Doesnt seem to really care and is very confusing on what he wants out of students.

Horrible class, don't bother going to lecture. Dr. Su does a poor job explaining everything, doesn't give clear guidelines on how he grades and gives homework's that take a long time that aren't related to what the testing is. 10/10 would not recommend.

This class was very disappointing. The material wasn't hard, but the poor teaching made it much more difficult. Lectures were disorganized and unhelpful, and questions were often brushed off. The final exam was much harder than the midterm, and grading was unclear. TAs were rarely available or helpful. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this class.

Dr. Su's 3751 was easily one of the worst classes I've ever taken. The midterm was pretty easy but the final was noticeably harder. Grading criteria was not clear on the final, as well. TAs were largely unavailable. I wanted to do well, but the instruction team's poor teaching and lack of help told me otherwise. The lectures were worthless. AVOID!!

Shows no passion for teaching and does not seem to care if you understand the content or not. Brushes off most questions and is unhelpful. Content is actually pretty easy but his teaching is so poor that it makes it about 10x harder than it needs to be. Also many mistakes in solution keys and exams
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR

Worst professor I've ever had… lectures are not coherent and ta's are NOT helpful at all. Just wanted to have a better understanding of information but they do not care to help you with the info or get a better grade. Horrible experience and very disappointing.
Really bad overall, tough grader with unrealistic homework expectations. Worst experience I've had with a professor at Ohio state.

Easily the worst professor in the MAE department. His lectures are a complete waste of time. Just watch the recordings on double speed. The content is not that hard but he teaches it so poorly. The midterm is pretty easy and was online. The final was in person and was not too hard but Haijun takes off a lot of points for no good reason.

The worst professor I have ever had. English is terrible. Lectures are useless. Often will use old diagrams that don't remotely match up to the question for both exams and homework. If you ask questions you are just told to figure it out. Grading is inconsistent. The TA will either give you all the point or none of them

Reasons not to go to lecture: It's easier to learn on your own, lectures are boring and overcomplicated.
Reasons to go to lecture: When he says  pin-in-slot
He is very nice and wholesome and means well

Literally the worst professor I have ever had. Horrible lectures, terribly long and difficult homework that constantly required extensions for the entire class, and a refusal to put in any effort whatsoever into the wellness of his students are what make this class unbearable. If you have ANY opportunity to take ANYONE else, TAKE IT.

Lectures are pointless. Bad English with poor direction. Homework's take forever to complete (he expects about 8 hours to complete). All the material you'll need you can find on the class page because sitting through the lectures is a war with your mind.
Do not bother going to lecture
good luck

Notes were useful, but actually going to lecture wasn't so much - he didn't have the best English. HW took a long time but doing it helped me learn the material. He was fair w/ grading, and gave us small curves for both the first exam and the class as a whole. Also gave plenty of prep material (practice exams, etc), although exams were tough.

He doesn't speak English well. He gets impatient when you don't understand something and ask about it. To be more fair, OSU switched to all online; so if I had a change face to face, maybe it would be different, but I don't think much different.

Homework takes at least 6 hours per assignment. Exams aren't *that* bad but the multiple choice problems are generally pretty tricky. Lectures consist of almost nothing but slides. There's a project for his half of the class which really isn't that hard if you get a good group. Attendance definitely not necessary. slightly hard to understand.
Exams are long. Homeworks are tough. Lays out what he is expecting.

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Design and Manufacturing of Compliant Mechanisms and Robots

Ratings.comment: The worst professor in OSU MAE department. Arrogant, disrespectful, and lacking patience with students. Many past and current students have complained about his demeaning attitude and poor teaching style. He likes to frustrate students insteads of supporting students' success. It's honestly baffling how someone like this holds a professorship.

Very disappointing professor in MAE department. No respect for students.The course felt deliberately frustrating rather than educational, and he was unwilling to offer help when needed. He didn't know how to teach. Other faculty members explain the material much more clearly. Avoid this professor at all costs!
Drop the class immediately if you see his name on your schedule. He has no respect for students, grades harshly, and has a condescending attitude in class.

No respect to students. Ignored multiple emails over a week requesting feedback, admitted it to my face + insulted my previous teachers!
 Openly complained to the class about his disappointment in us repeatedly. If there is a pre-req we need to brush up on, gives no resources to help. Humiliating. Yes, I got an A, top of class. 0/10: save yourself.

As valuable as his hands-on lab assignments were, I felt his ME 5139 course was an altogether disappointing experience. Considering unreasonably difficult tests and disdain towards class feedback on improving lectures, I do not recommend this professor to anyone seeking a genuinely interesting course free from a condescending and hostile attitude.

Professor does not record any lectures. Professor does not give feedback on homework, labs, and exams and does not tell you what you did wrong unless if you go to office hours. Professor does not want students to do well, professor wants the average to be a C in the class.

Class average was a C. Professor did not take feedback well. In order to do well in the class, you had to put in 20+ hours a week. Even though the class was software, 80% of the material taught in class was theory.

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Advanced CAE Simulation for Structural Design

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Advanced CAE Simulation for Structural Design

Ratings.comment: The best professor I had in mechanical. He wants you to succeed, focus on the fundamentals. Even if you did not do well in the midterm, he says if you do good in the finals, he will consider that. Awesome person, I wish all professor would be like him. So generous and want you to good, and feel confident. I would take any classes he teaches.

He developed and taught this course for the first time. The class covered a lot on topology optimization and process simulation. Many classes on hands on ANSYS and Inspire. Very flexible and accommodating, learned many practical issues on simulation.

Professor Sutradhar is the best professor at Ohio State. He offers students to retake midterms and helps students a lot. Exams, quizzes, and homework are literally what he teaches in class. Go to lectures, and you'll ace the class.

Alok Sutradhar was a great professor, he really cared about his and tried to get us to understand things conceptually rather than plugging in equations. Very funny and caring guy, I would definitely take his class again.

Professor Sutradhar is the most caring professor I have seen in Ohio State. Extremely knowledgeable. Classroom environment is very relaxed. Two terms and one final individual project. I did not do good in first midterm. He wants you to succeed. He gave a second chance to improve the midterms. Talks a lot on practical stuff. Learned a lot from him.

Solid lecturer, definitely knows his stuff. Towards the end of the year, the lectures started getting a little more disorganized, but it's hard to blame him since our only grader quit part-way through. The midterms and finals are worth a ton of points (20-20-35), but are graded very easily, with about an average of 80%.

One of the best I have seen. He gets the stress out of the class. If you want to learn the real stuff, conceptions and practical application he is your man. Generous grading, homeworks are balanced. I thought the final was a tad difficult that the midterms. Brings in a lot of physical objects for demo that was really helpful for me to see.

One of the best professor I have seen in OSU. Very caring and patient. Posted a lot of conceptual videos to help students. Also gave rewards for watching the videos and answer multiple choice questions. He allowed me retake the midterm II after I did not do well the first time. Really cares about how well you understand. Have been very supportive.

Some people asked about problems out of the book, he said he didn't like those problems because they were more academic and not realistic. He noticed that I wasn't trying very hard and told me that I was smarter than my grades reflected and challenged me to do better. The original schedule had 15 homework assignments, he cut it down to 8.

Powerpoints and some videos are posted ahead. Examples are covered in the class. Studying the powerpoint before the class helps. Midterms and quizzes were fair. The final project was a group project with groups choosing their topic. Make sure you have a good group. I did good with less effort in this class compared to some other ones.

He used lots of powerpoints and some videos. Homeworks are okay. The quizzes were fair. Study class problems for quizzes. Grades pretty generously. No finals, one huge group project. Review session before exam was helpful. He explains well during office hours. He also showed youtube videos of innovative designs in the class which was interesting.

Alok struggled to teach the class in a concise and organized manner. Spent a lot of time at the beginning of the semester trying to review, which ended up putting us behind. He seemed to be improving for the first half of the semester, but then just started reading off slides. He does seem to actually care about students, but is just lost

Dr. Sinha always brought a good attitude to class and was willing to do anything to help the students. Whether it is deadlines or personal accomodations, Dr. Sinha did a very good job working with students. He was always very helpful and caring when I talked with him. He is a great teacher and a great person.

Comments
The layout of the course, including the various presentations, helped convey the information taught. I have gained a fair amount of information from taking his class. Absolutely informative and helpful!

For how much content is taught in this class, Professor Sinha teaches it incredibly well. You'd have to be a mad man to try to teach all of the information the text book in one semester. Professor Sinha handles this with ease and grace. He clearly outlines the more important parts of the textbook and connects it to personal experiences and stories.

Dr Sinha is a wonderful professor and OSU is extremely lucky to have him! I am eager to take more courses with Dr Sinha. He is focused on teaching the students and helping them understand the content and not punishing them with assignments / bad grades. He works extremely hard and is an inspiration to all his student.
I believe that the professor is really willing to help students learn and grow.
Genuinely interested in teaching and helping students. Very flexible instructor which I respected.

Professor Sinha is very knowledgeable in this field and proved to be of valuable resource to the students. He was very invested in the success of the students which created a more learning conducive environment.

Very engaging professor and made a very welcoming learning environment. He introduced many ways on how to teach and do problems which really helped with our understanding of the topic. Is always very welcoming and ready to help any student in need! Would take another class from him.
He is a great person and a professor. The guy teaches so simply and comprehensively that there is no match.
Extremely helpful and caring!
Great Professor!

The instructor, Prof. Sinha is simply the best. He relates every topic he teaches to something physical making it easier for students to understand the concept.  He does everything possible to make the atmosphere conducive to learning. I should also mention that he knows the subject matter. In summary, he is an excellent instructor.

Hats off to this professor; he taught us such a complicated concept in advanced nuclear thermal hydraulics much easier. He is the true savior for midterm and overall class grades. We cannot thank him enough for what he did for each of us. Thanks, Prof. Sinha

Professor Sinha is not only a professor; he is a great human being who is kind, compassionate, and understanding. He welcomes everyone in his classes, and he will do everything to make students feel welcome in his classes and provided the best engineering knowledge.
He is a super helpful professor and cares about his students. I saw a professor who goes above and beyond to teach and help students during the busiest time of year.
Many HW and quizzes prepare you for the exam. Understanding and caring. What else you expect? Thanks Prof. Sinha
Great instructor, up to date course materials, helpful and caring. The best thing I like about his class that he focuses on fundamental concepts and expects student to be solid in these areas.

Prof. Sinha seemed to use chegg solutions for in-class problems on multiple occasions and did not catch that there were mistakes. When asked to explain the mistakes, he wouldn't give an explanation and just moved on.

Professor Sinha refuses to post his slides before class for unknown reasons, many students asked him to and he will not give an answer as to why. He is very unorganized during lecture, switching back and forth between slides and his 'whiteboard', writing and erasing things over and over even though it doesn't get any neater. Do not take his class.

Professor Sinha genuinely cares about his students. I had to leave this public comment after reading few other reviews. This professor really accommodates every one in his online classes and provides solid lectures accompanied with many practice problems. He really saved me (and others) for not having bad grades for the first midterm.
He is the worst prof. I have had at OSU. Like many other reviews say, you can't read his handwriting or understand him at all. AVOID HIS CLASS.

Professor Sinha is not meant to be an online lecturer. He is not proficient enough with technology to be teaching online. He does not take any feedback from students and assumes that students are always wrong when making suggestions or corrections. Its very hard to have any motivation going to his classes. Terrible.

This professor is A DISASTER. 1. Always can't finish lectures on time (10 min late sometimes) 2. NEVER give out lecture slides before lectures and have horrible hand writtings 3. Confusing accents 4. Promised to have 3-4 problems similar to homework but end up have EIGHT problems and one of them is equation derivation of an unknown equationinclass

This professor is the worst that I've had in 4 years of college. Can't read his handwriting and whenever someone mentions that they can't read it he tells them that they shouldn't have to be able to read it bc they should be paying attention. His accent makes it impossible to understand what he's saying. Assumes everyone understands and moves on

I really enjoyed every single bit of Professor Sinha's teaching and his care toward each student (I really mean it!). He always provided a good feedback of each assignment and also posted neat solutions to the course website. I was amazed by his depth of knowledge in advanced nuclear engineering. I recommend take all courses from this professor.
Be very careful not to be on his bad side. Will talk about random things during your exams. DURING your exams! Very rarely can answer your questions with out confusing you even more.

Well organized course work. Definitely thermodynamics should be reviewed before taking this course. I know some students may give him a poor review, but often times students can take out their frustrations with the course and subject matter on the prof and that's unfair to me. Really, you couldn't ask for a better prof., thanks Prof. Sinha!
Dr. Sinha enjoys what he teaches. Can single people out at times or keep going back to them for entire class. I wish the slides would be posted before class so that I could follow along.

I took ME4510 with Dr. Sinha last semester and this time ME4536 which was MUCH better than last semester . Exams were fair and workload was appropriate for a 3 credit hour class. I think he still needs to get a little more comfortable with students but I could tell that he made a real effort to get to know us this semester, which I appreciated.

Professor Sinha really cares about the students and the class. Although sometimes he may have struggled in simplifying the subject matter into something the class would understand, I could tell he was trying his best. He was very helpful with me , or even when I didn't have an appointment. He really cares about the students and their progression .
Covers good amount of materials, energetic, teaches efficiently, bringing topics close to cutting edge research.
Able to go over a lot of material in short amount of time. Very knowledgeable and it helps to disseminate core nuclear knowledge. He knows what he is teaching.
Well organized notes, lots of practice problems that helped my understanding. Always cares about  students.

Really enjoys teaching, gets the class involved more  so than 90% of my previous institutions. Knows the subject matter/theories extremely well. Always is fair in grading and brings a smile to every class.

The only word that describes this professor is that he is a scam. The university should give the students who took classes with him there money back because I can assure you they did not learn anything. He is a mess. Very unorganized. He gave us the syllabus 4 weeks after the class started, and he changes it every class. Doesn't do problems.

Worst teacher ever. Avoid at all costs. Just reads from the powerpoints he makes and expects you to understand it. I spent a lot of time reading from the textbook. Also, his tests are just too variable because he never tells you the difficulty of the problems he will put in them. Studied 15+ hours for each test just to get the A. Hated the class.

SEI.Subject: NUCLREN
SEI.Class Name: Nuclear Fuel Cycle and Radioactive Waste Management

Ratings.comment: Great person and professor!
It is impossible to not love professor Manoj. He cares so much about every student and helping them succeed. The exams and homework are not easy, but this class is enjoyable with Manoj.

Manoj is an amazing professor. He is great at teaching, not a tough grader, and helps his students to understand what is going on. This isnt the easier course, but he made it much more doable. I would recommend him to anyone who needs to take this course!

The best professor I've had at Ohio State. Really nice, super understanding about student's problems, willing to give extensions on HW and quizzes, lectures are super easy to follow and gives plenty of prep material for exams, which are a little difficult but definitely fair. All around amazing guy, a real gem.
Phenomenal professor. Very flexible with due dates and very helpful. He cares a lot about your success in his class and helps you achieve it. Always is supportive, understanding, and motivational.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He truly cares about the class and that you do well. It is an engineering class so you will still have to try but if you fail that class it is on you, not him.

Manoj is a great lecturer and is extremely knowledgeable about dynamics (the way things move and why). He always gives really cool examples to keep the students interested. He's really good at taking you from being a 'MATLAB dummy' to a pro at it.
He is a really good lecturer and very intelligent. Helps out and very eager to learn something from the students.
As far as Dynamics professors go, you won't do much better. Great lecturer and fairly easy tests/quizzes.

Good professor; course material really isn't that bad either. Just study the necessary amount for quizzes/midterms and you should do fine. He's also very helpful in office hours and is really willing to give you back missed points on exams, if you make a good argument that you deserve them.

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Methods in the Dynamics and Control of Human and Animal Movement

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Applied Machine Learning for MAE and Robotics

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Applied Machine Learning for MAE and Robotics

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Applied Machine Learning for MAE and Robotics

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Applied Machine Learning for MAE and Robotics

Ratings.comment: I took kinematic design and machine elements with him. In general I had a good experience in both and Carlos seems like a great guy and cares for his students. I also had a class with his dad who is awesome and easy going.

Castro gives a 10 hour long homework for a 2 credit hour class and doesn't carry your mistakes through on exams even though the problems have five related parts. So basically there's no partial credit. If you have an option to not have him you should take it.

He taught well during lectures, but the only annoying thing was being assigned quizzes Wednesday evenings due Thursday during my 8am recitation. Exams were fair and the final was a bit tough, but the class is what you'd basically expect.

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Design and Analysis of Machine Elements II

Ratings.comment: I had Lake for fluid dynamics EMAE 252 at CWRU. She is definitely the nicest professor I've ever had. She made herself very available outside of class to answer any questions. Lectures were quite hard and she didn't do enough practice problems. Exams were pretty similar to homeworks and the grading was lenient.

Avoid her if you can. Confusing lectures and tough grading. The class was taught way harder than it should be. Very picky about homework and take off a lot of points but her problems are confusing and have a lot of typos in the first place. Gave a few tophat questions for participation but only add to the homework which doesn't boost much.

First time teaching this class so she is still learning how to be a professor. She was nice but her exams were coming out of nowhere(and low average). Made confusing homework that is not relevant to the midterms. Review problems are irrelevant to the actual exam and she sometimes even don't know how to do them.

Brutal tests and very difficult and long homeworks. Honestly a decent lecturer, but writes out very long proofs to all the equations needed for the homeworks. This makes it a very difficult to figure out what you need to solve the hw problems. Tough class no matter who you take, Kiran is not bad, but not good either. Lots of TA office hours though

2030 was sooo difficult.  Video lectures are confusing just because he goes through long, complicated proofs to derive the equation you need for the homework.  Very cool to see, but it is difficult to figure out which equations you need. Better than average lecturer in person, but a little monotone.
Tests are problems nothing like what we do in class. This class will be the end of you. Beware.

Worst professor I've had at Ohio State. 0 help in office hours, tests include questions that students have never seen. Test format is horrid for Dynamics, forced to type equations with numerous variables DURING a timed test without access to any special symbols.

He is a pretty good professor, he changed his tests so now they're show work problems which is better than multiple choice (C averages). Does mostly example problems in class and gives similar type questions on the tests. The tests are kinda tough but not unreasonable.

Do not recommend taking ME 2030-Dynamics with Dr. D'Souza unless you would like 12 question multiple choice midterms and an 18 question multiple choice final with NO partial credit and a "none of the above" option for each question.

His exams are extremely tough. They are multiple choice with a none of the above so it's impossible to guess and there is no partial credit. He also does not use numbers only variables so you can check to see if you're right. Would not take again

D'Souza has just started teaching at Osu, so he's pretty new. With that being said, I really learned a lot from the lectures, and his tests are moderately difficult but not unfair. It is annoying that he likes to use tests with variables and no numbers.

Very tough tests with at least one curveball that you haven't seen in lecture. Does problems in class and homework problems with numbers then all of his tests are variable based, making them very difficult
Guy is tough but you will learn alot.

I'm surprised how bad of reviews he has. The CLASS is hard. It does suck that he doesn't use a book but his notes are good and he doesn't throw things you've never ever seen on a test. They are hard but he makes them so the later parts don't build on the earlier parts. Straight forward, requires studying, but he isn't a bad prof. Just bad class

Dynamics with D'Souza wasn't a very enlightening experience. There was no required textbook, and the course was based upon his handwritten notes posted on Carmen which he copied word for word on the blackboard. After he recited definitions and equations with no underlying explanation, we spent the rest of  class watching him do practice problems.

Very poor professor. The entire lecture is spent doing example problems and he does not excel at explaining the problems. The exams are ridiculous, only 2 questions and are all variable based. One of the questions usually would have an added element that was never seen in hw or class and would just generally make it ridiculous. Avoid if possible.

Terrible! There is no explanation of the material. He does not say why or because in lecture. You sit in lecture doing basic examples possible, then homework is the hardest application of the material possible. Pop-quizes are attendance based with extra credit for answers. Expect hard exams with curveball problems using only variables. Class avg 66

Worst professor at OSU presently. He updated the final grades and did not even shoot an email to notify it to the students. Neither did he tell the students how he has curved the grades and all. Just don't take his class. There is another professor taking the same subject take that class not his. 5

The exams are really hard. Nothing similar is taught in class to what is in the exam. Classes and notes are not clear. Moreover, there is no specific grading scheme or rubric. Also, the numericals taught in class include numbers, while the numericals which are on the test just have the variables which make the test even more confusing.

Its his first time teaching here. He is not a good professor, gives random quizzes that are like exam questions. give only 1 extra point question, alot of homework. Exams ARE HARD, goes through the lectures without details.

Sarah Wolff made this class unenjoyable. She provided over 100 slides per lecture and would read the title and then move on. She did not talk about any details of the topics and would expect us to know the smallest details on the exams. During office hours, she could not give any tips for how to review the material for the exams.

Sarah Wolff was super chill and made the class as easy as possible. She would often give us answers the day of the quizzes so if you attend class you should get a 100 on all of the quizzes. Lab reports were not too bad either!

Nice but class was set up so carelessly. We have to go over hundreds of slides for each midterm. For the final midterm we had to review 17 lectures with at least 40 slides on each. When asked for more specifics on what will be on the midterm and how to study off of so much content she wasn't able to give a clear answer.

She was doing her job perfectly! This was the first time that I did not search for any other resources in a difficult course. All class notes are provided via Carmen and homework is very good practice for midterms and final. The reason that I got this grade was exam duration. Be ready to solve long problems in a short time, PRACTICE EVERY MATERIAL.

One of the best teachers I've ever had. Her lectures are amazing, and she walks through the problems very clearly and step-by-step which makes it very easy to understand. The exam problems are all chosen from the lecture examples, recitation problems, and homework, so there are no surprises on the exam. Very nice, passionate, and helpful.

I really like Dr. Wolff, she's approachable, relatable, and wants you to do well. As long as you make the effort to speak with her, whether it's after class or during office hours, she will help you, unlike other MechE professors, and she genuinely is helpful. Tests are not bad at all as long as you put a little bit of effort into studying.

His class was overall disappointing. Lectures weren't helpful, Homework was excessive plus weird 10 PM deadline. Also made a homework due after the classes were over and during the finals week. Grade breakdown was also bad for class. Also he did not rounded up my grade even though I was 0.06% from an A and made a bad excuse for not rounding me up.

Dr. Stewart was alright. His lectures were VERY dry and stale; attendance was poor; they were the smart ones to skip. Notes often were hard to read. Grading was everywhere: sometimes fine, sometimes nonsensical. Grading took ages. Strange policy of no solutions for recitation sheets. HW was pure pain. Disappointing class that I dreaded going to.

He does not respect students' time at all. He gives 2 weekly assignments that each take longer to do than other classes' assignments. Homework is due at 10pm instead of 11:59pm. Example problems in the notes were often illegible. Directions on assignments are unclear, but he grades harshly. This guy made a 13 credit semester feel like 18 hours.

Hands down my favorite teacher at OSU. He is very understanding of the material and goes through everything slowly and in great detail. If you are struggling with something he will make sure to go over it again until you get it. He is very clear in his lectures about what topics will be on the tests and how to study for them. 10/10 would take again
Explains most things in good detail. Sometimes can seem robotic but his clear articulation of what's going to be on exams makes up for it. Allows older versions of textbooks which is nice.

Dr. Cho was a good professor! Her lectures were rather boring, though using the "flipped classroom" style of teaching, made class (sometimes) a recitation, which is when the class shines. Weekly quizzes were fine; don't make silly mistakes, as they will cost you dearly. The projects are good and very fair. Fine class all around.

From the first couple of lectures in 3260 I knew that Dr. Cho was an amazing professor. Not only does she truly care about every student in the class, but she makes a difficult subject such as dynamics ridiculously easy to understand. I struggled to grasp dynamics before I took her class. Her notes are excellent, and the quizzes/hw are fair.

Dr. Cho was the main reason why I did so well in this class. She structured her class in a way where you view lecture videos outside of class and then do practice problems during the regular lecture time. This, along with the homework, made it feel impossible to not know the content well by the weekly quizzes. She is now one of my favorite profs.

It's very easy to get full marks for the homework/quiz portion (20%) cuz solution will be given before you take the quiz. MATLAB  (10%) is also very easy and is not time-consuming. Two midterms (40%, 20% each) are fair, you'll be fine if you pay attention to the lectures and homework and take good notes. Final (30%) is a little harder. Easy A!!

Hanna may be the worst lecturer I have had in the department. The (ungraded) homework are much more simple than the exams, and her lectures are not always easy to follow. Her exams are primarily multiple choice questions with none of the above answer options.

Her lectures don't match the homework or the exams. Not helpful in office hours. She is a nice person but not a good lecturer.  Reads of powerpoint slides. Barely used the book. gives homework with solutions for quizzes which can be memorized and not learn anything. Take other teacher if you can.
