SEI.Class Name: Mechanical Engineering Undergraduate Research for Thesis

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Mechanical Engineering Undergraduate Research for Thesis

Ratings.comment: Satya is the goat!

Professor Satya was one of the best professors I have had at OSU. Very passionate about the material, inspirational lectures. The course was intellectually stimulating. Exams were difficult but graded leniently. Homeworks were long and difficult but prepared me well for the exams.

Had for machine elements 1, which was fine. This class has been completely different. His homeworks are long and difficult, but for this class, they're outright punitive (and have had numerous mistakes, which is unacceptable). The midterms are too long and feature difficult questions. Very inflexible professor.
God's gift to MechE students

The most caring and passionate professor I have ever had. Clear expectations are made for the knowledge you shall possess after being blessed by his presence. He is the Bob Ross of ME. Thank you Satya for pouring your soul out into teaching the way you do. I will buy a lottery ticket if I find even one more instructor that does it like he does.
Satya is one of the best professors I have ever had. Caring, knowledgeable, and good at teaching. He writes on the chalkboard exclusively, so attendance is mandatory.
Sets clear expectations for tests and homework, very enthusiastic lecturer
Professor Satya is my only mentor in 4 years college life. Thank you professor.

Satya the GOAT 

The material is VERY TOUGH, but he makes it manageable. Not too many homeworks but they take forever to do so it works out. If you have had him before then the flow of his lectures is similar to other courses. Only reason I stuck through this class was him. I would have dropped this class 1st week if someone else was teaching this.

Absolute legend. Gives great lectures that adequately prepare students for the homework and exams. He clearly has a mastery of the material and is always well prepared in class. He is patient with students and clearly explains his expectations. He also has a subtle sense of humor which helps to keep lectures engaging. Favorite ME professor yet.

Fantastic professor! You can tell he cares a lot about his classes and students. His tests were very fair, homeworks were challenging but also graded leniently. His lectures were awesome and he does a great job clearly explaining difficult material.

He is a really good professor who actually helps students understand the content. He cares about his students doing well and isn't a harsh grader. The exams are very fair and it isn't difficult to do well if you put in the work.
Satya continues to prove he is the goat, a respectful, amazing teacher and truly cares about his students. His class is also fair and I felt like I learned the content well.
One of the best professors in the MAE department.

Awesome professor. Great lecturer who cares deeply about the material he teaches and he wants his students to do well. Fair exams and difficult/long homework assignments but that's expected in upper level ME classes. One downside to Satya is that he sometimes takes things very personally in class and will publicly reprimand students during class.

He is one of the best professors I have had so far! The course itself is very difficult and intimidating but it was made easier through his teaching style. His grading was very generous and overall I'm glad I stuck through with the course. I would definitely take his classes again!

One of the best professors I had in OSU. Super clear lectures and neat hand writing. Lectures were all well-prepared and well-constructed. It was not an easy course but his teaching made this course 10X easier than it was supposed to be. 100000% would take his course again if I had a chance.

Talk about a love for teaching and a love for engineering. Dr. Satya was a wonderful professor. Very structured, ideal lectures. Presented clear notes. Outlined problem solving procedures and solved example problems. Open to questions, helped students truly understand material. Very responsive, flexible with accommodations, take him for any course!

One of the best professors you'll find at OSU. Very knowledgable and passionate about what he teaches. He is EXTREMELY understanding when it comes to grading. Always checking in on students and asking how they are feeling about the course, any issues un/related to the class, and how he can help. Seriously an amazing professor! 1000/10

Satya was one of the best profs Ive had so far at OSU. Extremely organized and thorough teacher who seems to genuinely care about his students and wants to take their feedback into account. The class was not easy but I definitely would not have done as well without him as a teacher! Definitely exceeded expectations; highly recommend.

Satya was an amazing professor. He clearly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Statics wasnt incredibly easy, but Satya made learning fun and very manageable. He has fantastic energy and a great attitude that inspires success. The semester was online, but Satya was still one of the best profs Ive ever had.

EXCELLENT. the best professor at OSU. I would take him 1000x again if I could. Lectures are extremely helpful, structures, and informative. He made lectures actually enjoyable to be in and I learned so much from him. Absolutely loved this class.

He is one of the best professors I've had. His lectures are pretty good, and I found myself able to learn almost everything in class. The exams were worth a lot in this course, but he was an easy grader imo. Just do the homework and the practice exams on your own, and you should be good to go.

A student from a previous class had come to look for something he forgot and left. 'Did he find what he was looking for? No? Kind of like life right.' Best joke I've heard from a professor. Tough but fair!

The best professor I have ever taken BY FAR! This man not only knows the material extremely well, but knows how to be the best professor. Everything he does is perfect. The grading is EXTREMELY fair. Go to class, put in good effort on the HW, and there is no reason you shouldn't get an A. You NEED to take Professor Seetharaman if you can.
I would follow this man off of a cliff. Very inspirational, very good at communicating the material you will need to know in order to do well in the class. If you take 2030 you need him as your prof.

Definitely one of the hardest courses in general for the ME program, but Satya is the best option. He pushes you to learn the material and understand it. His lectures make sense most of the time, and when he sees that people don't understand something, he will do his best to fix that. The homework helps prepare for the exams, and he grades fairly.
One of the best. There's a reason he has not received lower than a 4.0 on RMP.
A true legend. He actually cares about wanting to teach and wanting us to learn. I will miss him.

Satya is the best professor I've had. His passion is obvious; he truly cares about teaching the students the material and takes his time to thoroughly cover the information. His exams are also very fair and are easier than the homework and in-class problems he does. Take him; you'll have no regrets.
Teaches a pretty difficult course very well. Very clear about grading, very understanding. He knows he is teaching a hard course, and he acts like it. Great professor.

Satya is a diamond in the rough. 2040 is a difficult class in and of itself, but his slow and methodical approach to everything was very easy to understand and well worth the semi-repetitiveness. Homework does take insane amounts of time, but really it all becomes worth it. He's very fair and never has any surprises.

Satya is one of the best professors I have had. Has an accent but is easy to understand. The class is somewhat difficult. Homework takes hours, but the quizzes are take home and a lot easier. Gives a lot of partial credit on show work probs. Class curved at the end.

If only he would teach every class I take... He made me love what I thought would be a boring subject. His lectures were outstanding and they are something I will remember for a long time even after I am done with OSU. If I could be half the man he is I would call myself a success

Class was a jolly good time. 83% curved to a B+ if youre wondering what the curve is like. Satya is the type of professor you will never forget. You should aspire to be like this guy. Laugh at his jokes, one of his greatest disappointments in life is that his students dont find his jokes funny. Practice speed for exams, this will set you apart.

Satya was the best professor I've ever had at Ohio State. He had 4 lectures a week at 8 AM, and he made it worth getting up early to go to them. He's funny and very helpful. His board work is incredible, neat, and easy to follow. The class is a lot of work, but if you truly try to learn the material, he'll help you along the way.
Best teacher I've had, explains everything perfectly,

Dynamics could be a really confusing course for everyone, but Dr. Seetharaman made it easier to understand. The exams were easy and fair if you could understand all examples in class and problems in your assignment. In short, Dr. Seetharaman was the best professor ever!

Excellent lecturer. His board presentation is phenomenal. He knows what he is doing, and teaches in a way that is easy to follow. He is a difficult prof, but the best one I have EVER had. He is genuinely kind, and you can tell he cares about his students. Listen for his corny jokes, they will make your day. I've had Satya for two classes now! :)

Satya was my favorite professor at OSU. His classes are hard but show up to office hours and he will really help you alot. Also the more you show up to office hours the better you get to know him  you will find yourself in a good position in his classes.
Great man. He challenges you to learn. Studying Dynamics under him will be one of the high-points in my college career.

Great professor. Goes over the material slowly and thoroughly. He even took out a few topics at the end so he could better explain previous stuff. The only bad thing is that sometimes he goes a little too slow and it becomes boring. Other than that, he is the best, most prepared lecturer I have had yet. Cares a lot about student success.

Satya is the best professor I have had in my three years at Ohio State. He teaches at a nice pace and is willing to clarify anything at any point during lecture. He's really helpful in office hours and truly cares about his students' success. The material is difficult at times, but he makes lectures interesting and cracks jokes a lot

Professor Seetharaman is my favorite professor I have had so far at OSU. The class is challenging but if you go to class and pay attention it will all make sense. His lectures are FANTASTIC and if you put in the practice he will reward you if you are struggling. He is constantly going over examples so you will learn the material VERY well.

I had the pleasure of sitting under Satya for ME2010, ME2020, and ME 2030.  He came to every class very well prepared and presented the material very clearly.  He works hard in the classroom and expects the same from his students.... do that and you will do well and learn a lot.
Satya is the greatest professor I've ever had. His lectures move quickly but very informational and clear.

Satya is a stellar professor; if you're looking to learn, TAKE HIS CLASS. Admittedly, his classes are QUITE difficult, usually 2 exams and a finals; pop quizzes are assigned in classes and turned in 5-10 min after given. Study like hell, pay attention, buy the textbook and do your own problems for success. It won't come easy, but it'll be worth it

The best professor I've had at OSU. Very passionate for teaching and will make sure that everyone in his class will understand what he is saying. His lectures are extremely comprehensive. The tests aren't too difficult as long as you are actively participating in class. The best at doing his job!

Satya- Best professor I have ever had.  Explains everything so clearly and is extremely meticulous in his approach to lectures.  Class is well organized, and you actually learn conceptually what Is going on when he teaches.  You know what material is going to be on the tests but they are still a challenge.  Kind man who truly cares about students.
THE BEST EVER!!! TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!!
Go to class and do the homeworks thoroughly. Tests can be difficult at times.

Absolutely fantastic teacher. Both knowledgeable and passionate about the subjects he teaches. Practice exams very closely resemble actual exams. Very respectful of students and their questions. Course is not difficult if you attend class and take solid notes from lecture. Would jump at the opportunity to take another of his classes.

By far the best professor I have ever had a Ohio State. His tests are tough, especially if you slack off on the homework or miss class, but he is fair. The key is going to his lecture and paying attention. If you don't do that and you blow off the homework until the last second, you will not do well in his class.

Satya is awesome.  Took him for one class and made sure I got him again for the next. Lectures are easy to follow, gives great notes, and genuinely tries to help students succeed.  Holds review sessions before every exam, is a fair grader.  You can tell he's passionate about the subject, never misses a beat in lecture. Use the resources he gives

Very thorough in all his examples and methods. I wouldn't miss a class because the notes are very important. He does give pop quizzes. I'd highly recommend him for statics, materials and dynamics. Great instructor!

His genuine lovepassion for engineering is clear through his lectures, and his notes are AMAZING. Hand writes  all notes on chalkboard, unlike most of the lazy power point robots in the department, never misses a detail. I'm surprised this man has not wrote his own textbooks. I still use his class notes to this day for reference.
Go. To. Lectures.  Always holds reviews outside of class before exams which are very useful.   Test material isn't difficult, but Seetharaman makes sure you run out of time if you don't work quickly.
He is incredibly precise and clear in lectures, he encourages questions, and his exams are just like the practice exams. However, homework can be tough and sometimes he gives pop quizzes.

Satya is hands down the best professor in the ME department. If you get the chance to take him, you HAVE to. You may end up dreading the amount of material he feeds you or how hard the final exam is, but at the end of the day you can tell Satya cares about his students. He knows all his students by name, leaves notes on exams and is avaliable 247

Satya is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He's extremely clear and cares about his students. Yes, the material is hard, but he makes it manageable. Homework is long, but enforces the major points, and exams are fair. Make sure to go to class because he does give pop quizzes!
Satya is a very engaging and clear lecturer. His homework is challenging but manageable. One of the best professors at OSU!

Satya is by far the best teach I have ever had in my entire life. You can tell he loves to teach and is engaged in the material. He keeps lecture funny with a few jokes, and explains everything that is asked extremely clearly. His tests are fair, and his lecture is a must go to. Take notes, pay attention to him and you'll go far. 1010 love him

I'v been going to OSU for four complete years and I am very confident enough to say Satya is by all means the best professor/teacher/lecturer I've ever had at OSU. He's meticulous and very clear in his way of explaining things. He doesn't escape even the smallest detail in solving problems. I just wish I could have him in Dynamics too. Walid!

He was a great and engaging lecturer but you couldn't miss a class without missing crucial information. He posted helpful things online but you really just had to go to class. Only complaint is that the hw is hard and very time consuming and there isn't enough time given for the tests.
Very kind man; very very kind man. Go to his office hours, they are worth missing a class to go to.
Grades hard but warns you and is fair about it.  Tests are long and you have to rush to finish.  Very clear in lectures. Great Prof.
Amazing Professor. He curves well and his exams are much easier than homework.
Best professor I've had. Office hours are extremely beneficial. Great teacher, but definitely go to class.
Satya is an excellent professor. His examples are clear and well prepared. He also brings an entertaining and friendly personality to class. Great overall professor.
Satya is very prepared. His lectures were clear and helpful and he is more than happy to help during office hours. I hope to have him again before graduation. Take a class with Satya if you can.

Dr. Seetharaman is always well-prepared for class and fair. He presents material with detail, accuracy, and in a concise fashion. He barely has accent, and is very smart. Though attendance was not mandatory, he sprang many a pop quiz throughout the term (to keep students in lecture and awake). Exams are more about working fast than material itself.

Prof Seetharaman was a great professor. He explained and outlined everything very clearly and gave great notes and practice problems in class. Very helpful during office hours and will go through everything with you over and over if need be. But you HAVE  to attend lecture and pay attention to take full advantage of his knowledge
BEST PROFESSOR I'VE EVER HAD. He's very helpful and will get you to understand hard material.

Satya is the greatest thing that has ever happened to me.  One of my overarching life goals is to have beer and curry with him and discuss beam theory. He is clear in his explanations and happy to help during office hours. If you do the homework, the exams are straightforward.
HE IS BEST TEACHER BUT HE IS TOUGH ON GRADING....

The man is a genius and has the memory of an elephant. But his teaching style is not for everyone. Posts fantastic notes, has tough exams and even harder homeworks. Very helpful in office hours, in fact very kind. Use him wisely!!

He's a really great teacher. He has an accent but you can typically understand what he's saying. He posts the homework assignments online so the books aren't necessary unless you want to read the chapters. However, you can get away with just attending lectures and you'll be fine.

Great professor, very good lectures. He seems to enjoy writing on the board so be prepared to write a lot! I had him for ME 2010 (410) and 2030 (430), 410 seemed much easier than 430 but his teaching style is the same and he is very helpful during office hours.

Awesome and by far favorite engineering professor! Would definitely recommend. He does give a slight curve downward but honestly it is pretty much the same as in any engineering class. He is extremely helpful during his office hours and is very accommodating to fit with your schedule. All in all fairly easy class if you go and pay attention.
good.

Satya was a great teacher and a very nice guy.  Helped a lot with clear examples in class.  To the previous people that say he curved down, the grades were revised twice, bringing them back to where regular engineering grades should be.  Would definitely recommend him as a teacher

Easily the best Engineering professor I've had at OSU. His HW, quizzes, and exams are by no means easy but by damn if they're not the fairest I've seen. Warning, If you do poorly you can't blame it on this professor. If you go to class and put in the effort, you will do well, he practically guarantees it with how well he teaches the subject matter.
Overall good Prof. Was very helpful during office hours. Taught the course well but subject was dry. has his own wierd grading scale. HWs was way tougher than exams
Willing to help students who ask questions, but did a negative curve after the final without any warning.  Very hard to understand due to accent.

Did a great job teaching the class.  Example problems in class were clear, and exams were fair. However, his grading scale will give you a LOWER grade than you earned.  I got an 83 in the class (Which should be a B) and ended up with a C+. BEWARE!!

Satya teaches the material very well. He goes every little detail, which leaves for no confusion. His homeworks and quizzes are really hard, but are do-able. Do the practice exams, because the actual exams are very similar. Overall, he is a great professor! if you can get him, take him!
He is extremely organized and provides tons of example problems that are identical to the problems on the homework and midterms.

One of the BEST Professors I have had in my last three years at OSU! I would definitely recommend him for ME 410! Clear, Concise and Quizzes and Mid-terms are FAIR! Passionate about the class as a Whole! Pay attention to him and you will do just fine!
One of my favorite professors at OSU. I would definitely refer people to his class.

Professor Seetharaman has been the best professor I have had at OSU.  Professor Seetharaman is well-prepared, enthusiastic, extremely approachable, and honest.  The class has been extremely intellectually stimulating.  Please continue to include the trade-offs engineers face when optimizing cycles.

Satya is a great professor. Hopefully he stays at OSU for a long time teaching future ME students. With the ME department having so many older professors looking at retiring, Satya would be a perfect fit to stay in the department long term to teach/do research.
I like Professor Detrick as a guy, I just don't like this class very much and it felt a little disorganized.

Measurements is a gamble of how good your GTA is. Dietrich is very boring and hard to listen to but he does seem to genuinely care about the material and want you to learn. Go to class for the quizzes and if you expect to pass the exams go to the review. One of my least favorite classes, but no where near the worst professor in Mech E

Lecture was extremely dry. Lab was also boring, but difficulty was very hit or miss depending on GTA running the section. Be prepared to select a good lab group for lab reports and end of semester lab project. Exams were comprehensive, but fair. Professor's review sessions and office hours are helpful.

Lectures were boring but very useful. Detrick is a brilliant professor who is extremely helpful during office hours and review sessions. Exams were tough but fair. No surprises as far as expected material. Definitely requires effort, but he is a fair grader, so A's and B's are very attainable.
Detrick is boring and doesn't communicate the material well. He provides equation sheets with the exams but they are still memory heavy. Not the worst, but not good either.
Absolutely horrible. Did not get graduating senior grades in on time, horrible lab instructions, and condescending.

The most unique professor in the ME department. You must attend exam review sessions and go to office hours in order to comprehend the material enough to do well, since the lectures are all over the place. Detrick cares about helping students. Pop quizzes are essentially participation so make sure you go to lecture.
Great Knowledge of material but doesn't grade efficiently

This class was very difficult. The lab portion wasn't horrible, but the homework and exams were hard. He is a smart guy but not great at helping out students, and the lectures are just reading off of slides.

bad. just bad everywhere all the time. this man is clearly incredibly smart but he is a poor educator and incredibly unlikeable, the lab section for this class is a nightmare, the lectures are insufferable and include several unannounced pop quizzes, content is unbelievably boring and his style of teaching precipitates this issue

Avoid at all costs. This ME 3870 class is just a lot random formulas that detrick will mumble about on his powerpoint slides. I've asked detrick for help on my final project multiple times and he'll either stare blankly at my code and go "Hmmmmmmm" or say some amiguous answer because this professor has absolutely no clue what he's doing.

I think he spends too much time teaching other courses to teach all classes effectively. He often comes across as unprepared or rushed. Exams were hard and most didn't complete in time. Class average for exam 2 was 59.6%. The project is an easy grade booster but I think my exam scores did not accurately reflect my knowledge level.
Hes fair but I felt scattered in this class. The exams were so hard. Homeworks were long.

As with most statics related classes, this class comes with a lot of homework. Prof. Detrick's lectures are decent and cover the basics of the material. Exams tested you on the foundations of the course and if you didn't know what you were doing it was easy to get stumped. He has pop quizzes during class but they are graded for completion.

Detrick's a really good professor because his exams are fair and he does a ton of practice problems. You have to pay attention in class to everything he says though because he doesn't write down the "tying it all together" type statements but he says them. Also he has office hours 4 days a week which is super helpful.

He was a good teacher for this class. Homework wasn't too bad and the midterms were not hard. The final was difficult, but then again most finals are difficult. You have to show up to class because he gives pop quizzes which are a significant portion of the final grade, but they are easy points (he doesn't grade correctness for them).

Makes frequent mistakes in lectures and in homework. If no one points them out, then he might send an email later telling everyone to go back into their notes and correct it. Writes silently for a very long time on the board and then takes a few seconds to talk about everything. Quizzes are participation points, but exams are brutal.

Excellent professor. Homework is super hard and time consuming, but if you go to his office hour, he will always help you with any kinds of questions. He is very patient and smart. Definitely one of the best professors in ME department.

Fast paced course. Started writing on board before class even started.  Had review sessions that were 3-4 hours long outside of class time.  Very long homework and tough grader on exams and HW.  Would be tough but doable if I had lots of extra hours to do HW and attend countless hours in office hours.  Failed to acknowledge terror attack on campus!

Go to review before exams , He gives quizzes but he does not grade them so make sure you attend all classes then you will receive full credit on quizzes even if you just write your name and  the question you still getting %100. Just be there. Also he is excellent grader, does not take many points.
Matt is awesome, very clear and helpful. Homework is long, exams are fair.  You will learn a lot.  Perhaps the best instructor I have ever had at OSU.
Great Professor - Hard and expects a lot but very fair and you learn a ton

Matt is AWESOME! He is a caring professor that really wants you to learn the material. He holds lots of office hours and gives fair exams. Go to the review sessions. I would recommend Matt for 3260, 3360 or 3870.

Probably one of the best instructors I've had in ME. His homeworks take a long time, but he has office hours 4 days a week, really nice guy and is easily reachable. Conducts a marathon review session before every exam. Just go to that and you don't need to study at all. Two thumbs up

His homework is insanely difficult, as in 6-8 hours per assignment, and is basically impossible without working in a group and going to office hours. He's a really nice, helpful guy, though. Exams were straightforward and not too difficult, and he gives a 4-5 hour review session the night before. Overall great teacher.

He's very chill, but assigns SUPER long Homework.  But if you live at his office hours (6+ hours per week) you'll be ok.  DON'T buy the book!  He never uses it! His exam review sessions are the best I've ever had, and the exams are decent.  But plan to spend forever on the HW.
SOOO much work, as in four times the normal class load. Also not enough time on tests. Nice, helpful guy though..
He is ok and just let you slide if you work hard.

Just so everyone knows...Matt Detrick is actually a "glorified" grad student who has taught ME553, ME482, ME570, etc.  He is a great professor and his office hours/review sessions are fantastic, take advantage of them.  I needed no more studying for his tests besides review sessions.  Definitely the best in the department.

By far the best professor I have had at OSU.  Extremely willing to help.  He understands the material thoroughly and is great at getting it across to students. His lectures are good enough I never touched the book all quarter.

Probably the best teacher I've ever had at Ohio State, and after being there nearly 4 years, that's saying something.  Amazingly, he's not even a professor yet, but a grad student who is EXTREMELY smart.  The amount of time he spends helping you outside of class is incredible.  Work the HW's and do well on midterms to avoid the final.

He was the best teacher I have had yet at Ohio State. I can't get over the hours spent by him outside of class, either in office hours or review sessions. He was fantastic and I'm so excited to have him next quarter for 570. He is a fair grader and if you came to class and went to review sessions, you should have been well prepared for his tests.
awesome teacher, awesome dude... the most accommodating and down to earth instructor i've ever had, not to mention he's a genius

Best instructor at OSU--I wish I had him for every class. Had him for 482 the quarter before and was pumped to find out he was teaching 553. He's the most approachable prof there is, and he really wants you to know the material. I've emailed Rosie/Rebecca about cloning him so he could teach all the ME courses. They said they're looking into it.

Man, such an awesome guy. So much helpful, 2 review sessions before the mid terms. The subject as such is sooooo boring, he tried his level best to keep it interesting, really surprised to know that he is not a Professor, he is awesome...I hope you have him for ME 482 than ME 553, because RIZZONI is very bad in 482...must take and its easy. 10/10

Quite possibly the most helpful teacher I've had at Ohio State. The material was pretty difficult/confusing/boring, but he's more than willing to go out of his way to help you. Has 7 office hours for homework help. Kinda funny that the guy's not even a professor and he's one of the best instructors here. Maybe that's why he's so good--no huge ego.
Professor Ahmed is highly underrated. His class was fair and he tried to keep it that way. I thought his lectures were good.

Had him for 3360 (wasnt an option on here)
I feel like he gets a bad rap because the lectures were kind of boring but the tests reflected the lectures and homework.
Gave an extra credit project and was considerate about moving due dates 
Made a genuine effort to help students
does give pop quizzes for participation points

Prof. Ahmed was super inconsistent. He made us learn an entire coding language (Python) which was not in the course curriculum for 2 homework assignments that he never tested us on. His homework assignments took 10 hours a week to complete and accounted for 5% of the grade. Steer clear of this instructor.
By far the worst professor I have had at any level of schooling. First day of class, he claimed he didn't want to teach the class.

Very smart guy, but clearly is a researcher that the university required to teach a class. The content was not too difficult and his exams were fair, but he did not communicate the material well at all, and he rarely used Carmen so there were no materials provided besides the homeworks.

Definitely knowledgeable in the subject matter, but awful communication of the material. Lectures are terribly boring and he has little to no interaction with the class. Skipping lecture to read the textbook would be a more efficient use of your time. The exams are far easier than the problems assigned in the homework.

I took Professor Qadeer's Statics and Mechanics of Materials and overall found him to be good. He really does try to explain in lecture although sometimes I found his lectures to be lackluster. The homework is the toughest problems you have to solve and the midterms and quizzes are pretty easy. Overall 8/10 course.
Professor Kim is a caring professor but I didn't love his teaching. It was okay and easy but I didn't feel like I got a ton out of the class.

Really nice teaching style, does not confuse you with material you don't need, instead, lectures on what's going to be on the homework, and if you understand the homework then you are fine on exams. Final was tougher than all the midterms so I would be cautious with that. Gives really good partial credit on all assignments and exams.

Very good professor. Explains concepts clearly and is very organized with notes. Provides lots of optional practice exam problems. Course material is fairly difficult so go to lecture and pay attention. He provides answers for HWs and exams afterwards online so that's helpful. You can tell he cares about his students' success. Nice guy.
Best teacher all semester! He gives meaningful homework thats on the same level as the tests and his lectures are clear and thorough

Provides you will all the tools you need to succeed. Amazing notes and lectures. Very fair, and extremely helpful outside of class as well. There are few classes I have taken where I can honestly say I COMPLETELY learned all the material covered in the semester, and this is one. One of the best professors I have ever had in the ME department.

His lectures are clear and easy to understand. Learned a lot from this lecturer. Homework and quizzes every 2 weeks. Provides extra exam reviews that are extremely helpful. Very helpful during office hours, ask him anything whenever. Very humble lecturer. Not a fast grader but lenient.

Ratings.comment: Our class was supposed to be composed of quizzes and several projects.  His lack of organization caused us to only have 2 projects for the entire class.  We got no feedback whatsoever throughout the semester and the one quiz we did have in class he decided not to count.
Absolutely horrible lectures.  Powerpoint's are copy and pasted from the book.  Doesn't do examples in class.  Homework is excessively long.

Extremely poor lectures and excssive use of the word "effectively" which gets very distracting. The class isn't extremely difficult, but he doesn't explain the topics very well at all. ALL lectures on powerpoint and very minimal use of the board.
Lectures are very good.  Office hours are not.

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Measurements and Data Analysis in Mechanical Engineering

Ratings.comment: Siston is a great guy and really cares about his students. He even has a monthly lunch to just talk about life. Tophat questions every class "not for a grade" but up to a 5% bump may be given at the end of the semester based on ungraded participation and correctness. DON'T WAIT TILL THE LAST MINUTE TO START YOUR PROJECT.

Siston is the best professor I have had at OSU. He really cares about his students and wants everyone to really understand the material. He is passionate about teaching, and gives fair exams. Definitely recommend.

He tried a new teaching style of recording lectures, posting them online, and using class time solely for example problems. I never watched the lectures, just went to class and did practice problems and got an A. He's a stickler when it comes to deadlines, but if you talk to him, he'll work with you. Overall good professor.

Extremely hard to understand, reads literally straight out of the book and directly off the lecture slides.  Really no reason to go to class unless you don't know how to read.  He can be a real jerk too.
not as hard as he may be portrayed, very helpful with office hours and his lectures are interesting; there is a lot of work in the class, but it really wasn't that bad
No Comments
Awful lectures and a complete lack of care for students. He is unwilling to help or clarify concepts, making the course even more frustrating. Overall, not a helpful professor.

Prof. Hoelzle was one of my favorite professors during this past semester. He went above and beyond to bring real-life examples of control systems into the lecture. In addition, he took the time to learn each student's name. Moreover, the grading on the exams was fair. I recommend Professor Hoelzle's class to any student who is ready to learn.

teaches an incredibly difficult class in a way that is understandable and applicable. goes out of his way to make the content relate to real life, projects are a pain but there is lots of support from instructional staff. funny guy who is clearly very intelligent, makes taking the hard classes a little less bad

He's a super chill guy and is able to teach a really hard class in a pretty simple way. There's a project, weekly homework, 2 exams and a final. There's generally a curve on the tests, especially if the class did bad. It's a hard class, but he makes it doable.

Mid1 (35% of our grade) was very unreasonable. Not reflective of classwork or HW. I got a 50% lol. Lectures did not prepare us for 3/4 HW assignments at all. Mid1 graded very harshly (he gave an opportunity for extra points tho), but the final (35%) was very fair imo (I ended with an 95%). He ended up grading HW pretty lightly in the end as well.

This was his first time teaching this class, so I understand some of the struggles with the class. However, the lecture material was significantly different than what we were asked to do on our own. On top of that, when we would ask for help, we were typically told to refer to the lecture notes instead of given advice.

Lectures are disorganized and repeatedly fail to prepare for homeworks. Study guides are simply textbook problems with their answers below. Expect to learn a good chunk of the material on your own. What examples he does give in class often do not directly apply to the homeworks. Generally doesn't care about students.

This professors lecture basically reading slides, taking notes on his slides, exam mean is 65%  , he play a YouTube video when we are taking the exam and really distract us, and unclear test question that he finally find out smaller than 10 people get the last question correct. Tough grade, want steps that doesnt needed.

The worst professor in ME department I have ever seen, doesn't care students at all. Not even willing to make an actual practice exam, only thing he did was screenshot the textbook and put the textbook solution as a "practice exam". His notes are so unorganized. Exam questions are never practiced in class and are extremely harder than the HWs.

Had Professor Hoelzle online for ME 3360 in AU20. It was the most organized class I have every had. He does a flipped classroom, but it ends up being maybe 40 minutes of videos per week so very manageable. All homework and exams are reflective of what was done in the lectures. Overall a great professor and very nice guy!
Very nice and organized professor. Busy guy but he makes time to meet with students and really does a great job teaching the class. Overall, he is a nice professor and very worth taking a class with.

Hoelzle adapted incredibly well to online learning. Extra time on exams, review sessions, recorded lectures, and easy homework grading. Controls is hard, but he explained everything so well and intuitively. I learned so much in this class and really enjoyed it. His "flipped classroom" approach is the best I've ever seen. I wish he taught everything

Dr. Hoelzle made a notoriously confusing and difficult class easy to follow and understand, even in a pandemic. He sets up review sessions for the exams and help sessions for the project. His exams are somewhat difficult but fair. I definitely would take a class with him again.
He deserves better reviews on this site.

I'm not sure why Prof. Hoelzle has bad ratings, because he has been a great professor for SP20. He adapted very well to the COVID-19 crisis, and was able to maintain an environment conductive for learning. For example, he communicated with us very often, gave extra time for exams, and pre-recorded lectures. Plus, he's hot.

Don't be scared by the low points. As far as the course I had taken in 2018 spring, he was great. Good lectures. Very clearly informed the course materials and very organized lectures. Tests are fair. He opened review sessions that lasted hours to answer questions before tests and before project dues. And he is willing to talk to you.

I came into class scared due to the reviews of the past. However, instead of a 1 star professor, he was honestly a very good professor. He must have changed the way he teaches because most people felt this way. His lectures were informative and the tests were very fair. If you apply yourself and pay attention to lecture, you'll do great.
Super nice and a good professor who teaches a really tough class. Most of the people who didn't like him seemed to be students that weren't willing to come to class or work hard.
Run away from your life as soon as you see that you would be taking him.
If you have him, just change the class
Awful guy. The questions he asks in the exams are completely new. You wouldn't have seen or done something of that sort in class/homework/quiz/project. Bad lectures. Avoid him.

3 midterms + final, only 10 pts for 3 projects but each project is extremely tough and time-consuming which makes you don't wanna spend the time on it because it doesn't worth the price. This dude is just ridiculous, middle finger to him.
I was questioning that he throws you his project, so you are actually working for him  for free. TOUGH PROJECT
Go to class? You won't pass! Just stay at home and read the book. His lectures are very useless and this guy doesn't understand how to organize things. He is terrible.
such a bad class

This professor is so wired, he gave us the heaviest homework  and project. You have to do the homework, and then do the quiz. By the time, you have project to do. I would never take his class again! it is so bad!

This professor is the worst one I had in my entire college life especially in ME major. He is not really good at balancing everything for the class and takes advice that only few people give to him. Don't get him if you could. Seriously.
This guy is unfair and doesn't care about students at all.
Changed syllabus during the middle of the semester! He really makes your life harder! Don't choose him if you can!
Awful lecturer
Very unfair lecturer, assign easy quiz questions to some sessions but difficult questions to other sessions.
His solutions of the quizzes were ridiculous which we've nerve learned from his lectures. Avoid this guy
Gives many practical examples to connect dry material to real world applications. Could use the board more.
Tough, gives examples and is fair.

Worst Professor I have ever had. Did not give a damn about teaching the class. Rambles about nonsense for 90 percent of class. Expects you to teach yourself the material from the book, all homework and test problems are book problems. Does not answer questions and gives no information about what is on exams.

Professor Prakash really isn't a bad guy, but he it not a good professor. He teaches directly from the book and is not great at answering questions so class isn't really helpful. Grade is determined by multiple choice quizzes and exams with no partial credit and doesn't reflect what is taught in class! If you have the option do not take his class

Don't take a class with Prakash if you don't have to. Most of the material you will have to learn on your own by reading the chapters he tells you to in the text. His lecture content and examples don't prepare you for the difficulty of the exams. There is no homework, just weekly quizzes and exams that are multiple choice with no partial credit.

Don't take anything with this guy. He does not answer questions clearly in class, has no office hours, and shows dated videos instead of teaching. It is my firm belief that he wants to do as little work as possible. On his multiple choice exams, no partial credit. He picks trick questions that are very different from class examples. Really bad.

Professor rarely gives clear answers to questions and usually shows dated videos during class instead of lecturing. Exam questions feel particularly unfair and not comparable to the problems during lecture. All quizzes/exams are multiple choice with no partial credit given, and sometimes feel like "trick questions" intended to make you stumble.

He is unable to give a straight answer to any question and has set up his fully online course to be graded by weekly quizzes and exams, nothing else. They are exclusively multiple choice with no option for partial credit. If you read the textbook and do lots of preparation for exams, you may do well. The only good thing is that he canceled classes.

Avoid this professor. Extremely hard multiple quizzes and exams (so no partial credit can be given). Shows videos from the 60's instead of lecturing. Does not emphasize topics, but instead gives you the entire chapter to read and makes you decide that for yourself. Then tests you on the only material you didn't study. Prepare to teach yourself.
He did not seem interested in actually helping students. He did not have office hours and if you email him with a question, his response was brief and uninformative.

You won't learn anything.  If you are good at the subject, you can get a good grade. But if not, he is not gonna help you. He can make you worse at the subject. Rxamples are easy and exams are hard. Text book  won't help. very stingy and not reasonable in grading. He actually make you feel he hates you. Not easy to access,not helpful at all!

He has less attendance than the Teaching Assistant. Takes quizzes every friday. Second exam was hard and average was between 50-60. He has some good plans about having 30 hours in a day or working for 10 hours in a day so that you get 3 days off in a week.

Course structure could be better. Uses PowerPoint way too much. Quite helpful during office hours. Assignments are tough, but grading is easy. Very easy mid-term. Overall not a very interesting course but easy to get good grades.

Lectures were directly read off of posted powerpoints. Material was extremely dry and difficult to absorb during lecture. Homework and exams were difficult and require a large amount of effort. End of semester project and take-home final were challenging but were graded very generously and helped to boost grade.
He is mundane but easy, he cares about students and is understanding if you do bad on an exam.

Super nice guy and helpful outside of class, but not the best professor. The lectures are just reading off slides and all over the place/hard to read. No one goes to lectures. The class is very test heavy (90%), but the exams were not bad.

90% of our grade was tests, the other 10% homework. his lectures are just powerpoint slideshows without any notes you can write about so they'll put you right to sleep. if you can avoid taking him, do it.

Professor did not teach material relevant to the class. Lectures were unengaging often glancing through extreme amounts of theory and material with little to no examples especially when it comes to the homework. Often homework material is not covered at all or mentioned once in 30+ pages of slides.

Mumbles into the microphone all class and his handwriting is almost incomprehensible because he writes with a cursor rather than a pen. Exams are much harder than the homework. Homework's are graded on completion basis but quizzes are problems taken directly from the homework.

Hes not like the worst, but hes hard to understand and the tests are harder than the homeworks by a lot. I would recommend office hours and reading the book. Lectures are almost useless because he scribbles all over the sides and you cannot understand what hes saying about it.

You can learn different kinds of robust control in this class and use them to handle system uncertainties or time delays in the project assignments. Matlab and Simulink are necessary software for this class and the basic knowledge of the control system is preferred. A little bit boring in the class.

Don't take this course unless you really love the autonomous vehicle! This class covers lots of physics and control stuff although he claimed that he tried to make it more ECE like. In the class he just go through the slides, making people feel sleepy. You have to waste lots of time debugging the program or model he provided when solving the HWs.
he is on of the worst professors I have had at OSU, it is so difficult to understand what he says, the lectures are not helpful, the exam was so hard.

I don't get the complaints. Guvenc is a great professor, and you can tell that he puts a lot of time into his lecture notes. If you are a graduate student whose research depends on his class materials, this is the professor to take. He gives good background as well as great references.

As a junior ME student, he is the worst professor I have had at OSU thus far. Lecture was so confusing and unlike the hw, quizzes or exams. The final was ridiculously difficult. If you can avoid taking Dr. Guvenc, do it.

Not the best lecturer, but not the terrible one. He is lenient in terms of grading and trying his best to be helpful and clear to the students. Plus, this man is benevolent and he truly has a passion for automotive industry. And you will learn something in his class. He is an immigrant professor, so please forgive his English accent.

Not a bad  guy overall. Lectures can be redundant at times, but his exams are fair, and he is there to help you if you cannot grab the idea of his lectures and cannot do the homework. I wish he was a little bit more friendly, honestly.

Not helpful at all, he should not be allowed to teach.  I tried to go to his office hours multiple times and he wasn't ever there.  The TA was outside his office waiting too.  His English is hard to understand and he only cared about his graduate students.

Expect to study yourself. There are many things that you will need to learn your own. Tests are moderate. Provides lecture notes that are not very helpful. The best way is to practice the problems in the textbook. It's a faster and easier way to learn in this class

Lectures done on chalk board and followed the derivations almost directly from the textbook. I did not find lecture useful as actual examples were very limited. Low amount of homework/problems was convenient, but mostly looked to the textbook for guidance rather than lecture notes. Exams were comprehensive, but fairly easy compared to homework.
Great Professor, writes on the chalkboard and is more than happy to answer questions. He does in depth derivations so it's sometimes hard to know what level of the equation to start at on an exam.

Open book quiz every friday. Not very much homework. He is very clear in lecture and his notes are excellent. Never went to his office hours because if you pay attention in class and take good notes you won't need to. Open book and open notes exams.

So apparently a lot can change over 2 years. I always heard horror stories, but now this guy is pretty fair. Quizzes & midterm are mostly fair with the occasional outlier, the final was a bit harder but do-able. First half of class easy, 2nd half not so much. Ended up with a B/B+ depending on the final. If you work at it you'll get a decent grade.

Seemed ok, so I ignored previous ratings. I had missed 1 point by week 6 & everyone else was doing well too. Prof decided this was not ok, and gave mega hard quizzes the rest of the quarter, as well as a final on material that he never covered. I dropped from an A to a B+, even though I worked my butt off. Prof also avoids his own office hours

First exam was 'too easy' so he decided to give us stuff he never taught us on the final. The average was a 50% on it so my grade dropped from an A- to a C in 1 hour and 48 mins. AVOID THIS GUY AT ALL COSTS!

Terrible professor. Fluids 1 is a nightmare with him. Horrible book but he writes down derivations from the book and nothing else. Obscure question testing knowledge of traditional dynamics instead of having anything to do with fluids. Yells at people for making suggestions on how to better teach the subject.

Terrible prof, unfair tests, bad personality.  When I went to see him for advising, he snapped at me that I had better not be there for one of the questions in one of his classes.  The midterm was off-topic, and poorly written.  He had a question about an obscure Disney ride and mentioned himself and his daughter 10 times in the third person in it.

Interesting guy, but not the best professor. He mostly read off of slides and was not very good at showing which formulas were part of the derivation or the final form. Exams were easy and open for a long time.

Seems like a nice guy and the research he does outside of class seems cool. This class in particular was not difficult besides some homework just took a while. The notes he posts are pretty good and that's pretty much what I went off of the entire course and did well. Exams were open for a whole day or two which was nice. He was an okay Prof.

Dr. Hereid was okay. His lectures were nothing spectacular, a bit boring, but he did communicate the material okay. He is a nice guy, just do the homework and communicate with him about issues and you'll be ok for 3751.

Midterms were not too difficult, but he had to make the final exam on the very last day of school, and in person while all midterms are online. His notes are terrible, a lot of terms are not explained, too lazy to make any equation sheet for us. You would have no clue what to do on the hws most of the time, u would have to go to TAs office hrs.

Ratings.comment: Nice guy but the exams were unreasonably weighted and difficult.

Just overall messy semester. He seems like a nice person if you speak to him 1 on 1 but he didn't have opportunity for that because his office hours were on zoom. It seemed like he was disconnected with the class. Barely learned anything from him, mostly from UTA's and Youtube (and I went to every lecture but 2).
The grade for the class is mostly exams, but Prof Soghrati does a good job teaching. He gives you notes of each lecture online, but I think it is worth showing up to class anyways. Good professor.
Prof. Sohrati was a great lecturer. He explained things clearly and showed a lot of examples. The class was really organized and I always got the help I needed outside of class.

Professor Soghrati is an extremely professional and great lecturer. He posts his lectures online so you can always refer to his notes. You know exactly what is expected for you to understand after each class. That being said you still have to put a lot of effort into doing extra practice problems. Overall, a great teacher.

Great professor. Examples were clear and he posted his lectures online, which was nice. The midterms were fair, but the final was a bit harder. But, if you practice the problems in the textbook and do all the recitation and homework problems, you'll be fine.
Great Professor, very well organised and professional. Grading is very lenient!!!

Prof. Soghrati was the best instructor I have ever had at OSU. Clear lecture notes written on tablet, which were posted online afterwards. He was very knowledgable and intelligent, also very helpful. Noting bad to say. Exams could be easier though.
Great professor! Went over helpful examples in class and was always willing to help out. Material was difficult but the exams and homework were reasonable

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Finite Element Method

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Topics in Finite Element Method

Ratings.comment: Dr. Metzler takes the inverted classroom concept and reverts it to lecture while keeping "pre-lectures." Significant time is wasted, and the content is boring. Activities are fine. Lab is similar. The project is fine. Everything is fine, just tedious, really. The machining section is so much better. Oh, and lab reports, another time sink.

You will learn everything about arduino outside the class. She is not helpful in any way for projects. multiple large assigments and projects at the end of the semster compound on each other. Lots and lots of busy work. This is engineering, frustrating to have to yap in project reports for a grade. Class feels like checking boxes, not learning

Annoying amount of busy work for an engineering class. Somehow very combative and irritating to talk to. Will berate students for asking each other questions quietly during lecture or getting up to go to the bathroom. Thinks her class is more important than it actually is. She is knowledgeable outside of class, but not pleasant during class.

Professor Metzler is very knowledgeable and has much experience. You could probably have very interesting and helpful conversations with her about engineering as a whole. Her class, however, is not pleasant and feels like it could be about half as much work with the same outcome. It's not that bad, but more annoying than anything.

She gives way too much work. Doesn't realize you're an engineer with more meaningful classes. Changes the syllabus as you go. Very much busy work and not easy to get in touch with. She can get snarky at times if you ask questions. Honestly, a lot better tech electives to take. You're just teaching yourself with a book aid in the class.

Not a bad lecturer, but the sheer volume of largely inconsequential coursework made the professor and course as a whole unpleasant. There is interesting content to be had, but not when buried beneath 5 large assignments in the final 2 weeks. Additionally, a startling lack of organization resulted in much confusion and scrambling to meet deadlines.

One of those professors who thinks her class is more important than it is. She teaches the Arduino section and there is a lot of work that just feels like it's excessive. If you take it 2nd session, lab reports and quizzes pile up. Interesting professor, but ME has a lot of work outside of this class. Gives it a "busy work" mentality at times.

Ratings.comment: I think he genuinely cares about his students and is trying to simulate how a design project is run in the industry. His feedback is sometimes confusing because it feels like he's trying too hard to frame everything into how it would in an industry. He does use "buzz words" but, again I think he's trying to add the industry aspect to this class.

Professor Marzette does not deserve his bad reviews. He is a wonderful professor who gets you ready for what design engineering will be like at a large company, and I guess that is a shock to a lot of people. Yes, he does have a lot of papers, and they are lengthy, but overall, he is an extremely knowledgeable professor.

Very inconsistent, very confusing. I don't think I ever got any positive feedback ever, just very confusing and long winded reasons why everything we did was wrong. This was the worst experience I've had during my entire school career. Stay very far away. If you do get stuck in his class, don't stand out. Just quietly do your work to get by.
Poor communication, disorganized lectures, and unhelpful feedback. Assignments are confusing, and the professor seems indifferent to student concerns. A disappointing educational experience.

Do not take Professor Marzette's class; choose any other capstone. He changes his mind on the team's work every day. There was so much reading with very little learned from the course in the end. Grading is done with Grammarly; he copies the paper into Grammarly, finds all the errors, and enters your grade based on the results.

The most inconsistent professor that I've ever had. He would say two different things on the same day. The amount of busy work makes it seem like it's a writing class instead of an engineering class. He also talks with buzz words to make simple concepts seem so much more complex.

His grading is opinion based, so it depends on how he is feeling that day. No lie, one day the TA helped us structure an entire function tree. The next day, he said that it was awful and that we should restart. The TA came over and said that it needed to be fixed as well. The day after that, the TA told us that the original tree was great. cmon man

He needs to lighten the course load and understand that the projects can be completed more efficienctly. Capstone helps prepare students for industry projects, and many students have at least two interships prior to this course. We know what is asked of us in the work force. Whereas, this class requires 10,000+ word reports and 100+ page ppts...

All around terrible professor, coming from someone who did well in his capstone class. He constantly wasted students time and was surprised when people didnt finish their projects because of it. He used unfair grading schemes and seemed to have no interest in actually understanding/ helping his students.

Prof. Marzette cares about his students and encourages feedback, but he runs this class like a consulting firm... and majority of mechanical engineers do not plan on consulting out of college. Extremely formal and theory based approach to engineering design, which comes with hundreds of typed pages of project management deliverables.

Not my favorite professor. Isn't the best at explaining things, especially since its mostly verbal. Can be helpful at times but the way the class is set up and the way he gives you information makes it soooo much harder than it needs to be.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Hard to catch the main points in his super long lectures. Tons of paperwork make me wonder if this is English 4900. Tough at grading because I don't know what he wants. if You ask for a yes or no question, he'll talk for 10 mins without letting you catch if it's a yes or no.

Do not take general capstone if you can. He will let you do a lot of paperwork other than the design process. The rubric is not clear, you need to talk with the professor and TA to know what exactly and how to do.

Stay as far away from General Capstone as possible. Take a capstone you're not interested in at all before taking this option. The professor assigns you under mountains of paperwork that will make you question whether or not you want to actually graduate at the end of the year. Little to no time is spent actually working on your project.

Atrocious professor. Take a different capstone class if you are mechanical. You will be spending 10-15 hours per week doing paper work that does not help with your design. Except to spend 10% of the class doing legitimate work and 90% doing busy work that is graded based upon a subjective rubric.

He explains things poorly and makes Capstone design more about documenting than actually making something. About 95% writing reports/presentations, 5% actually designing. Do not take 4900 with Marzette, you will learn nothing for two semesters and be incredibly stressed out about completing lengthy assignments constantly.

Ratings.comment: A genuine and a caring professor. I like him very much.

Took Intro to Nuclear with Khafizov. Lectures are extremely long and mostly just non-important information. Makes lots of mistakes during problems. Class was not that difficult, but Khafizov is still not a very good professor at all.

Spends 75% of the lecture talking about things that aren't related to exams.  Hw questions aren't relatable to the questions asked compared to examples given in lecture.  Exams are long and pressured for time.  Examples in class have the wrong answer half the time and the students need to correct his mistakes.  Has no clear grading criteria on exam

Ratings.comment: It's engineering mathematics combined with the control system, thermal, and fluid. You better doing engineering mathematics well, otherwise, you will spend a lot of time preparing them. 9 HWs in a semester, 2 mid-term, and 1 final.
Very patient professor, inspirational for future research

Second time round taking a class with Prof. Menq. He gave us all the notes. No textbook. Only had 3 exams (all equally weighted), last one was take-home, no final. Really friendly prof, made learning controls fun. HWs relied heavily on MATLAB/Simulink. They were a little challenging but really interesting since they involved lots of simulations.

This class was an introductory controls course for grad students. Prof. Menq provided all the notes for the class, no textbook. HWs were kinda interesting and fun, and  involved the use of MATLAB a lot. Prof. Menq was clear in his teaching & always willing to help inside and outside of class. 1 midterm, final was take-home! Great prof great class!

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Lumped Parameter Modeling and System Analysis

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Lumped Parameter Modeling and System Analysis

Ratings.comment: Prof has accent; Prof is difficult to understand. Prof's lectures are confusing. Prof does not explain concepts in detail. Prof does not create an atmosphere conducive to asking questions and promoting learning. Prof unavailable to make meetings with students. Prof does not answer questions about homework. Prof does not complete example problems
Not helpful, lacks ability to teach material rather just shows you it.

Overall a pretty good professor to have for the class. 2010H only had 13 students in total, and she clearly made an effort to learn everyone's names. The homework was often harder than the lecture problems, but the exams were pretty fair and had EXTREMELY high averages (well over 95s at times!). My only issue was that her notes weren't very useful.

I like Professor Katsube and think she's funny and makes class interesting. Exams counted for 70% and covered tough content. Try and do practice problems beforehand. Her lectures go a little slow and are posted later if you are good at learning through notes but are disorganized. Homework is completion but helpful. She is a very kind person.
Katsube is unintentionally hilarious and makes very difficult material easier to understand and wants you to do well in her class
She thinks that yelling is teaching and the core material is taught in pre-recorded videos that are of poor quality.

Although I truly believe she does her best to prepare the students for the brutally difficult content covered in this class.. she still does not convey it well. She goes way too slow in class doing maybe one or two examples that are usually simple compared to the homework, quizzes, and exams. I understand the content is terrible but still.

Nothing she explains makes sense. Her lectures are slow work through examples and with the lack of explanation, the class is impossible to pay attention in. You basically have to teach yourself the material for the tests.

The worst professor I have taken in all 6 years of college. She rambles on the same stuff that doesn't pertain to her exam questions. The lady provided the opportunity to do well during the first half of the semester with decent quizzes. Then as soon as you start to get the hang of the course, she runs over you you with irrelevant quiz questions.

Professor Katsube is hysterical. She cares about the students and wants everyone to succeed. She understands that the topics and always asks if everyone understands. She will walk up and down the aisles of the lecture hall and call on you, so make sure youre paying attention. Overall, enjoyed her class.
Dr. Katsube is the goat. If you're there to work hard, she will be there to work hard to help you succeed. Also she is hilarious.

Katsube is a little bit crazy and all over the place when she lectures but I didn't mind that too much because it kept me awake in class. The homework is not too bad and she gives you a chance to check it with her or the TAs so that you can almost always not miss any points on it. The exams were a little tough though.

Don't take any course with her. Midterms are easy and the final is impossible. Even with a low final average, she would not curve the class. She failed like 20% of the student in that class. If you have a choice, take it with another professor. Avoids her if possible.
She was always all over the place while lecturing and it was hard to follow example problems that she did in class. The content wasn't too bad but the exams were quite challenging.

Katsube will put you on the spot no matter where you sit! I sorta like that because it keeps me engaged. I think she is a little silly and you either love or hate her but I thought I learned a great deal from her! You can tell she is very sweet.
Nice and caring professor. Usual weekly homework and super-easy pop quizzes. Exams are a little tough but fair.

Dont take any course with her. the homeworks and quizzes are so easy, but the midterms and final exam is extremely hard. half of the seats were empty after the second midterm. she said there will be a curve because of the low average, but she never did that.
Nice and caring. Usual exams and homework

The midterms, homework, and quizzes were a piece of cake with 80% averages, but then she kills you on the final with a class average of 40%. If you have high midterm averages be prepared for an impossible final.

Her lectures are always entertaining.  She is very quirky and likes to yell at people during class for talking and sleeping.  She does a good job of preparing you for exams and the class should really be an easy A as long as you pay just a little bit of attention during lecture
Tests are pretty easy. She's not always very clear when explaining things. Don't fall behind because its hard to catch back up. The reviews she gives are helpful for the tests make sure you do them.
Hard to understand what she talked in the lecture, but exams are very easy, basic

Homework, quizzes, and midterms were pretty easy if you went to class and paid attention. She made sure you knew what would be on the midterms. The final was tough though. Very long and hard to finish in time, which I'm guessing was her intention. Overall easy and straightforward but watch out for the final. She yells a lot too.
"Pop" quizzes were always on Fridays, that made it easy to remember when you should come to class. Homework is straight-forward, tests are not too hard. Katsube takes FOREVER!!!!!! to return tests

She had pop quizes but all of them were on the syllabus for practice problems for that week so it was obvious what was going to be on it because you went over the other problems in class. Homework was helpful and her style was different but I would not say bad. If you show up to class and actually do the homework (not cheat online) you will be fine

She is a horrible teacher. Nothing she says is relevant and she makes it very difficult to learn. Constant pop quizzes so you have to go to her lecture. Her lectures consist of going over 1-2 practice problems for 55 minutes. Dont take her. I didnt have a choice.

It's impossible to take her seriously, and her method of teaching is just pointing to a new figure from the book each week. I've learned way more from the textbook than from going to lecture. She gives random quizzes in lecture all the time so you have no choice but to attend her incredibly boring lectures. I wouldn't recommend her.

The wierdest professor that I have ever had by far. She would walk down the aisles and stop in front of random students just to say hi. She wasn't organized at all and it was very hard to follow her work.  Tests were hard but decently fair.

I like her style of teaching. She picks quiz problems from practice problems on the syllabus, and goes over many examples. Midterms are challenging but usually fair. Finals are really rough but there's always a decent curve. She's very smart and knows what shes doing. Pay attention and show up to lecture and you'll be fine. Also had her for 430.

I never learned anything when I would go to lecture. Would spend an entire class doing one problem. Her way of teaching is terrible, does not explain what new material is being taught. The class average for both midterms and final were around 50-60% in my class. I do not recommend her

ME 430 is the most difficult class I've taken so far. Katsube was a decent teacher overall; her quizzes were confusing, homework and midterms were fair and straightforward, and her final was impossible. She says she won't curve the class, but she actually does. Overall, she's very fair.

She might not be the greatest teacher, but she's really helpful and her quizzes and exams are very fair. I had a great TA for recitation, that helped a lot as well. But if you just do all the homework problems and the examples in the text, and you will definitely end up with a high grade.

Quizzes were taken DIRECTLY from the practice problems and the exam questions were very similar.  I just studied the problems on the syllabus and got an A.  She's good at keeping attention by yelling loudly.  I thought she explained things okay, not great, but she does a lot of proofs which is really boring.

Just like every other professor that teaches the ME 4XX series: USELESS.  Quizzes and tests were "fair" but it was more helpful for me to study the material for 1:18 than it was to attend lecture.  Don't sit in the front row, or on the isles, as she will heckle you while you take your quiz/exam.  She is very enthusiastic, and made me laugh though..

Great professor.  Doesn't throw anything unexpected at you.  Is very good about doing example problems when she senses the class is getting lost.  Book is more helpful than the lecture notes overall, but her notes are good for seeing how to do a problem.  Very approachable and has an interesting sense of humor.

Explanations are a little hard to understand. She focuses more on what you should not do than how to actually do the problems. However, you can see she is very enthusiastic about teaching and knows the material well.

It is a good thing the concepts were easy because she was very bad at explaining new concepts (thick accent).  Katsube wasted class time by calling on people to answer questions.  She really loves teaching, but just isn't that good at it.  Pop quizzes were annoying and exams were fair.  She told you exactly what types of problems to expect.

Not really a bad teacher... Just gave tough tests. Seems pretty reasonable and if you ask her to help you out with your final grade and you showed that you put forth effort she will. Annoying at times but the fact that she learns all 200 peoples names is not only impressive but shows that she does care about teaching. Take advantage of this

Final has no relation to the class at all...considering the final is 30% of your grade and determines your weight in the class.  I got A's on both midterms and still barely passed the class due to the final. She can be extremely annoying and wastes class time with her "notes." everything was easy except for the final, take her at your own risk.
does a lot of examples which helps with exams but exams are difficult
The final exam would have no relation to whatever taught in class, as told by people before, this definitely is the toughest ME course......
This teacher isn't very clear and wastes time in class

Her teaching is ok, exam material is fair, grading is only fair within her own class, but is not consistent across other sessions.  This is a straight curve class, but exam is a common exam made by the dept.  If you enroll at other class that is not a straight curve you will get a better grade than her class. I recommend taking prof Lee.

She sucks at lecturing.  She plays the name game half of the class and asks people in class to tell how to do problems when she is trying to explain them so it takes 3 times longer to do them.   She had HW due before her lectures cover that section so you have to teach yourself.  Tests are fair.  ME 420 is a hard class but she sucks at teachin it.

Very poor presenter. Examples problems usually end up a jumbled mess. She tries to get class participation by randomly calling on people. This does not help with the examples because she'll extrapolate something from what students suggest and go off on a weird tangent solving the things, but in a very mucky way. The TA was much better.

She is pathetic in teaching and knowledge. She just hand-waived every difficult topic. And when comes to grading assignment, she is just 6th grade teacher. She seems to penalise points for spelling mistakes.
Loud and annoying, but very knowledgeable and willing to help.  My biggest problem was that she was very bad at explaining new concepts.

She's not that bad a teacher.  The class is hard but she's more than fair.  Looking at older reviews, everyone complained she is hard to understand.  But, she seems to have improved her accent because it's not hard to understand her now.
430 is by far the hardest class I've ever taken. Thats just how the class is though, Katsube taught it very well. She worked through lots of examples and involved the students. Final was rough.

Easy class if you keep up yourself.  Unclear in teaching... didn't know how good she actually was until she had to leave for a week and a joke of a replacement came in.  Remember to write your name on her quizzes.  No name, no grade.

ok i don't get the rumors that me410 is hell, although katsube cant speak english and plays the name game half the class she makes her exams very fair, she's not the best, but there's worse, so take it with her, plus there are plenty of easy points ie CAI
If u wanna learn statics, Katsube is the best. Dont go by her accent or looks, shes a good good professor. She will make your ideas clear until "is it clear".If you are taking 420 take her class.
Can't understand  word that comes out of her mouth

She's a little crazy, kinda hard to understand, plan on moving around in different seats everyday so she doesn't learn your name (otherwise you'll be answering every question she puts on the overhead)
ME 430 was probably the hardest class I've taken at Ohio State. Plan on a lot of studying and going to all her office hours if you want to pass this class with Katsube.
Bad accent. Was extremely unhelpful.  Would not take a class from her again.
Fair but difficult to understand.
No Comments
