Ratings.comment: Professor Glover has a very straightforward teaching approach which I appreciated. Honestly, the content covered in the course isn't too difficult to begin with but he still was able to communicate the topics very well. Only complaint were constant HW corrections towards the beginning of the semester which caused some frustrations.
Quality capstone prof. great feedback and always helpful.
Not really helpful in his office hours, expect you to memorize every word he says. Tough exams and very tough grader. Not recommended at all.
Very hard grader, will stay away from his classes in the future, homework and assignment take so long to finish.

One of the best I have ever seen. Cliff deserves to be given the best lecturer of the year, hands down! Go to class every day you have one, do all hws, go to his office even if you think you don't need help, you will find out you do.  Also the readings he assigns, very important to do.
Cool class, cool teacher!

Go to class! It's the lecture that is most worth your money in the AAE curriculum. Most outstanding prof for sure - ask for help if you need it and he will help you. Super friendly and approachable. If you need anything, go to him. Consider doing research sometime - he may help you out a lot! Exams reasonable - study hard and you should get an A.

Cliff was an outstanding professor. Definitely one of the best if not the best in the AE department. The class was pretty tough and the math (lots of multivariable calculus and diffEQ) got pretty intense right from the start. However he acknowledged the difficulty level and would really work with you to help you understand.

Had him for both 1181 and 1182. One of the best professors I've ever had. Great guy who is understanding, and always willing to help. Excellent one on one help during office hours and genuinely wants to help you understand.

Class was easy. Cliff is really easy to talk to. He is ready to help and makes his instructions very clear. His easy-going attitude is not to be mistaken with immaturity though. He takes everything very seriously, and does not like people who act like idiots and break things.

Very fair and helpful. Assignments were very easy and it was easy to get a 100 on exams as well. Lab reports could be somewhat annoying as you were penalized for tiny things (-5 for using paperclips instead of staples, etc). Uses questions that tie together a lot of concepts. Only wish he didn't focus so much on aero!

One of the most helpful and patient professors I've known in OSU! Goes around class a lot to make sure our questions are answered. Go to class, do the homework on time, and ask him a LOT of questions and you're set to get an A.

Extremely good prof.  It's quite a relief having a prof as good as him in the Aero department. He does examples in class that you will need to look at for homeworks, and the homeworks help you directly with the midterm/final. He does a great job using one question to pull together concepts from a couple examples, so you need to think but it's there

Very helpful, understanding, fair and nice. Strike up conversation with him, it makes the class more enjoyable. I would highly recommend trying to get him as your professor. Also he's quite easy on the eyes.
Flexible and understanding. Easy to get along with and very helpful in class.

His class was pretty easy as long as you went to every class. Both the TA's and Cliff are really helpful. The class time is essentially office hours after he teaches. Easy A, definitely recommend taking.

Ratings.comment: Great professor, lectures are clear and informative. Homework is extensive long and requires effort, but he is helpful through office hour and email.

Professor Canova is a very helpful and understanding person. Although his class consists mostly of presentations, he still did an admirable at getting ideas across by giving us challenging but manageable homework. Midterm was fair, the final was a little tricky but still fair. The project took a lot of time-make sure to find good teammates.

He is a brilliant Professor. He listens to your problem and knows exactly where the problem could be, i.e. excellent trouble shooting skills. He makes sure you understand whats going on and does not mind repeating what he explained. All-in-all, a great professor, a great human being and extremely knowledgeable!

He explains things very well and makes you do very few/no tedious calculations. Once you get over his italian accent there is no problem understanding him. Exams aren't as easy as the assignments but they are fair. He gives you plent of warning as to what will be on them.

Ratings.comment: Horrible professor; only reads from powerpoint. His tests are weighted AFTER you take them; meaning during the tests you do not know how much each question is worth making time allocation impossible. Not enough time to take tests; BIG curve at end though. Avoid if you can!!!
Reads straight from lecture slides. Randomly assigns point values for exam questions. Much more focused on his research.

Oh Heremans...what to say.  It appears as though he knows thermodynamics, but he has trouble communicating. I would recommend going to lecture with the textbook. Listen to him occasionally while reading the book and doing hw in class. Even though he's not a good teacher, his exams are fair.

Not a very good engineering teacher. He isnt even a ME professor, he was trained as a physicist. Indeed there is alot of physics in thermodynamics, but I dont really care about that. He needs to spend more time applying the principals and helping us practice for the exams, which were pretty difficult.

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Irreversible Thermodynamics and Transport of Charge, Heat, and Spin

SEI.Subject: MECHENG
SEI.Class Name: Irreversible Thermodynamics and Transport of Charge, Heat, and Spin

Ratings.comment: Anna is SO helpful and knowledgeable when it comes to your academic career. She is always a pleasure to meet with.
She is a saint.
Very attractive. Easy class as long as you go to class. Do not skip any classes. Easy to sit in class because its just basic material on the curriculum for your major and how the university operates.
cool

Huseyin is one of my 2 favorite prof's from OSU. I would LOVE to take another one of his classes. His exams were challenging, but his teaching style is extremely effective and he is also pretty hilarious. His accent makes him sound like kermit the frog, but in a good way :)

Great professor. Lectures are based on both theory and application, goes over plenty of examples. Is really helpful is you go to his office hours. Exams are fair given the subject matter; the final is hard but not impossible.
great professor, grades are difficult given the setup but you learn the material regardless, taking again this quarter
He is a really awesome guy, and going to office hours is helpful if you had trouble with this class. Final is hard, but fair.

was a very helpful professor. im not very good at mechanical engineering and he really explained things so that i understood them. office hours really do help and can make or break your grade. great guy!
He was a good recitation instructor. Explained the problems well and was helpful in office hours.
Great teacher, If you go to office hours you will do much better in the class.  tests can get pretty hard

I found the class to be really easy.  Provided lots of notes, plenty of examples, helpful in office hours if you used them.  tests were fair, just study the material and practice along the way.  Use the recitations to build your understanding.

Not a good teacher. Like already commented he grades like an idiot and is very unwilling to admit on mistakes. Exams were fair although the second midterm was almost all first midterm material and he didn't tell us it would be.
Had for ME410 and ME420. Good guy. Well organized, does lots of examples, very willing to help. He grades fairly, but expect to work for and A. Runs his classes very efficiently.

He is ok at lecturing although sometimes his accent is hard to understand. His tests are pretty easy material-wise but this is nullified by the fact that he grades like a complete nazi .dont make even the slightest algebra mistake or u are screweed

Cute Turkish guy (28-ish)..but not hot..so helpful though! Has an accent but still very clear in his teaching.  Does tons and tons of examples and some are on tests/quizzes.  Go to class! Impossible to teach yourself because book makes a ton of assumptions w/out explaining why.

He applies the material very well, he's not one of those academics who wants to see how many angels can dance on a pinhead. The class is informal and almost as much fun as when the hogs ate my sister. He constantly speaks in cute witticisms that prove he's so old he doesn't buy green bananas anymore. Find a better professor? Can't do it, babe!

One of, if not, the best teacher I've had since coming to OSU. Many professors are good at explaining things outside of class (applies to him of course), but even in class, he is exceptional at explaining things. Always makes sure people understand things as well. Displaying understanding is where the points are at too, despite calculation errors.

Overall a good teacher. At times during class, he would mess up a number or two but he or someone in the class usually saw the mistake and corrected it. He was always willing to explain things in different ways if the class was not understanding the information. There were weekly quizzes and homework but the in-class examples were helpful.

This professor was one of my favorites. His lectures are posted online incase you miss them but his lectures are clear and his class moves at a good speed. He was always available outside of class and you could tell he was passionate about what he was teaching. Don't underestimate his kindness, it was still a very tough class.

Overall it was a very difficult class, he explained the material well and repeated himself often to make sure the class understood. The class builds on past material.  The tests were very straightforward and easier than the homework. He was articulate and easy to understand. He sometimes made mistakes in calculations, but he often caught himself.

People were way too hard on Matt. Considering that this was his first time teaching this course, I think that he did a great job. So what he made a few miscalculations in class? He still followed the correct methodology. I thought that he was very clear in his lectures, and was helpful at office hours. I also love that he's this quirky hipster guy.

Previous review was deleted, hmmm. Matt is the Ph.D student working under Satya. He has a tough time articulating his thoughts in lecture, makes too many mistakes on the board every day, and has poor handwriting and drawing skills, both of which are very important to teach this class. Confusing at times so I relied on the book for example problems.

I really enjoy Matt's teaching. Though he's still a Ph.D. student, he knows what he's talking about. He really tries to engage with the class, which I appreciate. I enjoy the structure of how he works through problems, too. Also, he speaks clear English, a real gem in the engineering education world. Office hours are amazing. Very nice guy, too.

He made a difficult subject matter a lot easier to understand by explaining the concepts and methods with his insights and giving many examples. He kept the class awake with jokes sometimes. I felt well prepared for my 3360. good professor

His lecture is very good and funny. Both the midterms are very easy and average grades are around 90, but the final exam has one or two hard problems. You do not need to go to class and just read the notes he posted.

Decent professor. Does a lot of examples in class which I like. The whole class up until the final exam was pretty easy and straightforward. 2/5 questions on the final were pretty difficult which was the only hard part of the whole class. No need to go to class. Can just learn the material by doing the homework.
Great teacher, excellent lectures
super cool professor

He uses the blackboard to teacht eh class, which is better  follow his examples. Homeworks required knowledge of MATLAB and Simulink. It was a good class. If you know how to do the homework, you get an A in the class.
super cool course!

I dunno why everyone else is complaining...he makes everything crystal clear and does examples that are much harder than the homework or midterm.  Go to class and pay attention and a B is effortless.  The exams are super straight forward just regurgitate procedures gone over in lecture...closed book and notes though!
Dr. Wang explains the concepts and methods pretty well.  you will do great if you follow his notes/homework closely.

his midterms actually were pretty basic and if you were good at the fundamentals you could do very well; basically just look at his notes and if you know the material you can pull of an A more easily than in most other ME courses

He lectures almost directly out of the book.  His tests are somewhat hard.  Doesn't give much partial credit unless you have exactly what he wants at each step.  Homework is often long and poorly covered in lecture.  This book and lecturer skip a massive amount of steps and algebra.
excellent professor, clear explanations and outstanding pedagogy, one of the best I ever had.
Best teacher ever.  Constantly wanting to help

An above-average teacher, gives many breaks in the class (perfect attendance gets a 1% bonus point, plus dropping the lowest homework and quiz grades). Lots of work but that's true of any course in Engineering.
One of the best professors I've ever had at OSU.
Great professor, actually cares about teaching. Made control systems classes more bearable. Good job teaching the theory, very helpful in office hours. Very fair
Tests are verbatim the same as lecture problems and homeworks.

Professor Sheets was very good at getting tough concepts across for the first half of the course. The midterm was fair, but had quite a few questions when compared to other engineering exams. The second half of the course was tough because the ideas were difficult to understand. Project was easy. FINAL WAS A TOTAL CURVE BALL and blew my A+
Lectures are ok, but his office hours are great.  Very helpful.

Good young professor.  Pretty standard engineering teaching style.  Goes over some basic ideas at the beginning of class, and goes over some more challenging examples. Midterms and final were pretty straight forward, but there was always an easy,medium and hard question on all tests.  overall, above average teacher.

I think the one who wrote below is wrong, I think he is so passionate for teaching ME 410 class, he's also interested in helping each one of us. Exam and Quizzes are very reasonable. Do a lot of homework problems and I ended up getting an A
He is young but can be a good teacher

This professor is completely incompetent. The first day of class we were telling him how to solve the problems because he kept screwing up. Does not curve even though the other teacher teaching the exact same class does curve so the average is a B+. Do not take him he is worthless.

Very helpful teacher. He teaches very clearly and very interesting. Quizzes and exams are kinda difficult, but if you came to class and do the homework, your will surely get an A. A lot of effort surely worth it in this class.
Very knowledgeable and helpful TA; knows a lot and good at troubleshooting ANSYS/Abaqus; he responded to my emails within reasonable time too.
I hated statics before I met him
a very nice guy, helpful and friendly
you *have* to take statics with this guy. cool and easy. very understanding. explains very well with interest.  can be caught ogling occasionally.

One of the best teachers I have had so far. Genuinely interested in teaching you and super helpful. Does enough practice problems in class and makes sure you get the point. The nicest person I know personally too so if you can, definitely pick his class. Likes to be called Bob.

Bob was a very clear and helpful teacher. He always shows intermediate steps and gives ample time for questions. If you pay attention, there's no way to be lost in the class. Office hours were also extremely helpful. He's passionate about teaching and it definitely shows in lecture quality.
Great TA.  ..."I'd back him in a fight".
Great guy, works out problems that are helpful in an extremely clear manner. Tests are fair to the students. Would recommend to anyone.
He is a great teacher. Extremely helpful. Just works problems in class which come in handy on the tests or homework.

This man is by far the best professor I've ever had. I only came to this website to give him a great review. I wish he'd do more teaching than researching...  He's fair, nice, and overall a great human being

Out of the greatest oceans of knowledge and understanding of System Dynamics and Vibrations anything is a fair game to ask students in his exams. He misjudges what is expected and asks questions in exams that he never would have taught in class. Take notes in his class otherwise you are done for. His monotone excitement may make lecture boring.

Honestly, who hired this guy? The class was in no way helpful for the complexity of the exams. Its obviously this course was a major crash and burn for his first semester at OSU. Now me and my classmates are beyond nervous going into controls with no great knowledge of systems thanks to the poor coordination of this semester.
Find another professor. Makes the class much harder than other me3260 sections and grades reflect it. Unclear with expectations.

New professor. Gave a midterm that might have averaged a 30%. Unrealistic with the expectations of knowledge for his students. Provides no material to prepare for exams then asks very conceptual questions. His examples are usually not helpful with hw/exams. I would recommend taking this course with another professor.
He is a smart guy but not a good professor. His midterms are extremely hard.

An excellent professor. Very clear explanations and fair grading. Great sense of humor. Does not waste time at the lecture and always works examples. Uses blackboard most of the time. I got an A in the class without opening a book even once but I attended all of his lectures. The exams are no surprises.
